author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: I sometimes say that I don't make anything up - obviously that's not true. But I am uninterested in writers who say that everything comes out of the imagination. I would rather be in a room with someone who is telling the story of his life, which may be exaggerated and even have lies in it, but I want to hear the true story, essentially.
author: James Salter

quote: I have never been able to pay attention to anything for more than a few minutes - the stories in my head have always been so much more entertaining. Only books could pull me out of my own imagination, and then it was only to plunge me into someone else's.
author: W. Bruce Cameron

quote: For someone who writes fiction, in order to activate the imagination and the unconscious, it's essential to be free.
author: Manuel Puig

quote: It was just very interesting to me that certain types of women inspire people's imagination, and all of them were very difficult women.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quote: My imagination, my ability to understand the way love and people grow over time, how passion can surprise and renew, utterly failed me.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quote: Possessing a healthy imagination is a necessary ingredient for creativity.
author: Steve Vai

quote: There are one or two very good women military historians who use imagination, great study and research; they can put themselves in the boots of the soldier.
author: Antony Beevor

quote: I just love music - by no stretch of the imagination am I professionally competent.
author: Vikram Seth

quote: I understand what it is to go through emotional trauma and retreat and go into the world of your imagination. I understand how art and music can be a place of safety in a world of reinvention.
author: Sam Taylor-Wood

quote: I live in words. I like looking at things, but I don't have a strong visual imagination.
author: Colm Toibin

quote: I think what's really the most ideal thing is for the player themselves, within their own imagination, to carve out what they view as being the essence of the character.
author: Shigeru Miyamoto

quote: Being an actor means asking people to look at you. I guess I accept that. But it's a profession in which the job is to show another world and other people. You may access it through bits of yourself, and your imagination and experience, but actually, in the end, you're not playing yourself.
author: Ralph Fiennes

quote: I find Godzilla exciting because he/she/it comes from the sea. It's entirely plausible that it could be real. Yes it is! It doesn't take a huge stretch in the imagination to imagine that something may be living at the deepest depths of one of our oceans.
author: Rhys Darby

quote: Every time you get on a stage or in front of a camera, the whole exercise is about imagination. You're constantly depicting something that doesn't exist, and trying to find the reality of it. Once you settle on that premise, everything else is a matter of degrees.
author: Ron Perlman

quote: The Polar Express is about faith, and the power of imagination to sustain faith. It's also about the desire to reside in a world where magic can happen, the kind of world we all believed in as children, but one that disappears as we grow older.
author: Chris Van Allsburg

quote: The general effect of viewing 'Jumanji' is thrilling. I was able to see on film a thing that at one point had only existed in my imagination. I got to see the images from my book come alive.
author: Chris Van Allsburg

quote: There is nothing heavier than compassion. Not even one's own pain weighs so heavy as the pain one feels for someone, for someone, pain intensified by the imagination and prolonged by a hundred echos.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: I enjoy working on a movie that lets your imagination run wild, it's great to be a part of and watch.
author: Chris Hemsworth

quote: When I was a teenager, reading for me was as normal, as unremarkable as eating or breathing. Reading gave flight to my imagination and strengthened my understanding of the world, the society I lived in, and myself. More importantly, reading was fun, a way to live more than one life as I immersed myself in each good book I read.
author: Malorie Blackman

quote: Cynicism and naivety lie cheek by jowl in the American imagination; if the United States is one of the most venal nations on Earth, it is also one of the most earnestly idealistic.
author: Terry Eagleton

quote: I have been afraid all my life that I am going to die. All my life it has been stuffed in my imagination.
author: Patty Duke

quote: When I achieved the European record for reciting pi in 2004, this captured the imagination of Professor Simon Baron-Cohen in Cambridge, and he finally diagnosed me with Asperger's that year.
author: Daniel Tammet

quote: If when we are taught English we are just taught the rules of grammar, it would take all our love of our language away from us. What makes us love a subject like English is when we learn all these fantastic stories. Feeding the imagination is what makes a subject come alive.
author: Daniel Tammet

quote: I think most of the time you can make something happen, and it's about not letting your imagination be limited by that.
author: Jane Goldman

quote: Imagination is Reality Lite - a useful substitute when the real pleasure is inaccessible, too risky, or too much work.
author: Paul Bloom

quote: Imagination tends to be truly useful if accompanied by the power of mental control - if the worlds in one's head can be purposefully manipulated and distinguished from the real one outside it.
author: Paul Bloom

quote: I box two to three times a week. I don't like going to the gym because it's boring. I really like boxing because you have to combine concentration and imagination. I feel like I'm actually learning something that's useful.
author: Stephanie Sigman

quote: People who don't see their nature and imagine they can practice thoughtlessness all the time are lairs and fools.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: Toy Soldiers was my introduction to film. I certainly didn't think I was doing art by any stretch of the imagination.
author: Tim Robbins

quote: I can get very philosophical and ask the questions Keats was asking as a young guy. What are we here for? What's a soul? What's it all about? What is thinking about, imagination?
author: Jane Campion

quote: There's no artist in this world that doesn't enjoy the dream that if they have bad reviews now, the story of Keats can redeem them, in their fantasy or imagination, in the future. I think Keats' poem 'Endymion' is a really difficult poem, and I'm not surprised that a lot of people pulled it apart in a way.
author: Jane Campion

quote: I feel that directors at times are like the janitors on the set. I am the secretary, I am the organizer, I am the maid, and I ask if they have eaten or rested. The best things are always out of your control. It's those moments that surpass the imagination that are thrilling.
author: Jane Campion

quote: God has given us an imagination, and our imagination is really the principle tool from which all creativity and artistry comes from.
author: Erwin McManus

quote: You can have 10 bucks to 10 million bucks and if you got a crew, imagination and a lot of people willing to turn in some work next to nothing, you going to have a feature. But you can't get beyond how expensive marketing the movie is, it's so crushing.
author: Kevin Smith

quote: As an actor you have to have a strong vivid imagination as you're working and when the camera's rolling, but there's certainly a part of you that is aware of real life, that you're making a movie.
author: John Hawkes

quote: For memory, we use our imagination. We take a few strands of real time and carry them with us, then like an oyster we create a pearl around them.
author: John Banville

quote: The first piece of music that captured my imagination was probably Ray Charles Live At Newport.
author: Van Morrison

quote: Learn to see things as they really are, not as we imagine they are.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: Reason respects the differences, and imagination the similitudes of things.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: If the reporter has killed our imagination with his truth, he threatens our life with his lies.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: There's no reason for your imagination to be fettered by money.
author: Kevin McCloud

quote: I have a vivid, apocalyptic imagination.
author: Sally Mann

quote: There's just so many great stories in the past that you can know a little bit about, but you can't know it all, and that's where imagination can work.
author: Geraldine Brooks

quote: My greatest strength as a child, I realize now, was my imagination. While every other kid was reading and writing, I had seven whole hours a day to practice my imagination. When do you get that space in your life, ever?
author: Barbara Corcoran

quote: Writing is a mysterious process, and many ideas come from deep within the imagination, so it's very hard to say how characters come about. Mostly, they just happen.
author: Michelle Paver

quote: All the best have something in common, a regard for reality, an agreement to its primacy over the imagination.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: Politics is the enemy of the imagination.
author: Ian Mcewan

quote: The goal of 'Data Detectives' is to spark the imagination of students around the globe by making them think about new technologies that will impact humanity in ways similar to language and art.
author: Rick Smolan

quote: For a 12-year-old with a hyperactive imagination who liked to dream of dreary gothic castles, suburban Florida felt a little stifling.
author: Ransom Riggs

quote: My books are elegiac in the sense that they're odes to a nation that even I sometimes think may not exist anymore except in my memory and my imagination.
author: Richard Russo

quote: All of the stuff I can't afford to do on a TV budget, I just put into the comic book because you're really only limited in a comic by your artist's imagination.
author: Marc Guggenheim

quote: Any acting is a stretch of the imagination. That's your job. Acting is truth in imaginary circumstances. Acting with green screen or a motion capture stage, you're striving for absolute truth in absolutely imaginary circumstances.
author: Sam Worthington

quote: To me, stretching the capabilities of my imagination is a crucial aspect of writing fiction; you could think of it as a mental form of athleticism.
author: Julia Glass

quote: As a little girl, my destiny was stamped onto the canvas of my imagination at 5 years old. I was watching soaps with my grandmother... The most gorgeous black women I had ever seen in my life came out, and I knew that that is what I wanted to do - be fabulous and black and on TV.
author: Niecy Nash

quote: When you are a people's movement, you have one thing. Your only asset is people. And you have to deal with real people. Not the people of your imagination. Not the people you wish people would be. But people as they exist actually out there in the real world.
author: Norman Finkelstein

quote: Three centuries after the appearance of Franklin's 'Courant', it no longer requires a dystopic imagination to wonder who will have the dubious distinction of publishing America's last genuine newspaper. Few believe that newspapers in their current printed form will survive.
author: Eric Alterman

quote: I guess just a lively imagination is the best effort an actor can have.
author: Jacki Weaver

quote: There's something magical about a home run. It almost violates the space of the stadium. It's a game of the imagination in some ways. Baseball.
author: Alex Gibney

quote: Radio listeners often have a very fertile imagination when it comes to body shape.
author: Tamsin Greig

quote: I believed in myself. I never imagined myself as just an ordinary player.
author: Imran Khan

quote: If my accent betrayed my foreign birth, it also stamped me as an enemy, in the imagination of the producers.
author: Bela Lugosi

quote: I always won in my imagination. I always hit the game-winning shot, or I hit the free throw. Or if I missed, there was a lane violation, and I was given another one.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

quote: Imagination has a great deal to do with winning.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

quote: To say that such-and-such a circumstance is 'Kafkaesque' is to admit to the denigration of an imagination that has burned a hole in what we take to be modernism - even in what we take to be the ordinary fabric and intent of language. Nothing is like 'The Hunger Artist.' Nothing is like 'The Metamorphosis.'
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: I don't agree with the sentiment 'write what you know.'... I think one should write what one doesn't know. The world is bigger and wider and more complex than our small subjective selves. One should prod, goad the imagination.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: My children have been all over the world, and I think it's so good for them: expanding their horizons and imagination and seeing how other people live.
author: Keeley Hawes

quote: London has always provided the landscape for my imagination. It becomes a character - a living being - within each of my books.
author: Peter Ackroyd

quote: I have always believed that the material world is governed by nonmaterial sources, so that in that sense 'English Music' is an exercise in the spiritual as well as the material. I have always been attracted to the Gothic and spiritual imagination, and I've always been interested in visionaries.
author: Peter Ackroyd

quote: When I was a boy, I was a worrier, and so was my son, Joe. I used to tell him that worrying meant he had an imagination and that one day he'd be pleased.
author: Anthony Browne

quote: Inspiring passion in children for books, and the world of imagination and creativity fuelled by them, is a fundamental reason for why the Children's Laureate post exists.
author: Anthony Browne

quote: Picture books are for everybody at any age, not books to be left behind as we grow older. The best ones leave a tantalising gap between the pictures and the words, a gap that is filled by the reader's imagination, adding so much to the excitement of reading a book.
author: Anthony Browne

quote: There's so much more that I want to do. Of course it's great what has happened so far: Ultra, Coachella, EDC. But still, production-wise and show-wise, I'd love to play a show at Madison Square Garden. Stuff like that is beyond my imagination.
author: Martin Garrix

quote: My daughter has a vivid imagination, and so does my son.
author: Nicole Ari Parker

quote: Every parent knows this moment in a child's age when he or she needs your attention in a very specific way because it's the beginning and ending of the early life of imagination. It's such a responsibility.
author: Nicole Ari Parker

quote: I still have a photo on my wall of the greatest idol I will ever have in my life, and it's myself at eight. Because that's when the forces of imagination have the same value as the real world, when they're an instrument of survival: when my mother disappeared, and I imagined a mother. That was me at my best.
author: Henning Mankell

quote: Humiliating events have a way of capturing the public's imagination. So it has been since antiquity, when gladiators were pitted against each other and the legions of Spartacus were crucified in endless rows on the way to Rome.
author: Gary Weiss

quote: I became a novelist because of 'Gone With the Wind,' or more precisely, my mother raised me up to be a 'Southern' novelist, with a strong emphasis on the word 'Southern' because 'Gone With the Wind' set my mother's imagination ablaze when she was a young girl growing up in Atlanta.
author: Pat Conroy

quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: My approach as an actor has always been the same, in that the greatest gift that you're ever going to have is your imagination because you're not going to have all life experiences. So you draw on things that are sort of close to it but you spend your time expanding on it or drawing something specific on whatever your situation is.
author: Vince Vaughn

quote: I do as much comedy as I possibly can, but I'm basically limited by the imagination of the secretaries who make the decisions.
author: Rufus Sewell

quote: Only World War II, which mobilized 10 million draftees, could by any stretch of the imagination be called a people's war.
author: John Gregory Dunne

quote: I've been working on the soprano saxophone for 40 years, and the possibilities are astounding. It's up to you, the only limit is the imagination.
author: Steve Lacy

quote: I deeply adored my mum. She was an extraordinary person, even for the prejudice I'm likely to have. She was beautiful, amusing, a tremendous elaborator of things into comic proportions and extravagant in her imagination.
author: Andrew Motion

quote: I have an active imagination.
author: Anya Taylor-Joy

quote: Reading changes your perspective and feeds your imagination.
author: Najat Vallaud-Belkacem

quote: I like to have a thing suggested rather than told in full. When every detail is given, the mind rests satisfied, and the imagination loses the desire to use its own wings.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: Dwellers by the sea are generally superstitious sailors always are. There is something in the illimitable expanse of sky and water that dilates the imagination.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: To my mind the boy who gives least promise is one in whom the critical faculty develops in advance of the imagination.
author: Quintilian

quote: Life-writing calls for any number of dubious gifts: A touch of O.C.D., a lack of imagination, a large desk, neutrality of Swiss proportions, tactlessness, a high tolerance for archival dust. Most of all it calls for an act of displacement. 'To find your subject, you must in some sense lose yourself along the way,' is Richard Holmes's version.
author: Stacy Schiff

quote: I ask questions. I watch the world. And what I have discovered is that the parts of my fiction that people most tell me are 'unbelievable' are those that are most closely based on the real, those least diluted by my imagination.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: I just can't afford to get bored, because if you've been blessed with a generous imagination, which a lot of actors have, to be engaged, to be stimulated, is to liberate your imagination.
author: John C. McGinley

quote: To be in a show like 'Miranda' that captures everyone's imagination is amazing, but it's hard when people can't see beyond that. I started travelling to North America because 'Miranda' was so popular in the U.K.; I always knew I wanted to challenge myself and not go for the obvious roles.
author: Tom Ellis

quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: I use a lot of film images, analogies, and imagination.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: I feel very giddy with the idea of making my imagination take form and being able to put on a show where people leave feeling like they've experienced something.
author: Carly Rae Jepsen

quote: We are fascinated with our own history, and we are fascinated with the Romans because they were millennia ago, and yet they still capture our imagination because they were actually so similar to us. They were very civilized. They had a very similar political system.
author: Kit Harington

quote: I write from my imagination, not from what I've read in books or seen on TV or to make money. I wrote from an idea I was passionate about.
author: Dirk Benedict

quote: They seem much rarer now, those auteur films that come out of a director's imagination and are elliptical and hermetic. All those films that got me into independent cinema when I was watching it seem thin on the ground.
author: Toby Jones

quote: The idea was always going to be that each year is a stand-alone story, which did make it easier on some level. It also requires the network to have the creative imagination to say, 'This is also 'Fargo,' you know what I mean?
author: Noah Hawley

quote: Meeting Australian mountaineer and author Tim Macartney-Snape when I was 16 in 1994 had a big impact on me. His ascent of Everest from sea to summit captured my imagination.
author: Tim Cope

quote: An idea is a putting truth in check-mate.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: The imagination is man's power over nature.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: To regard the imagination as metaphysics is to think of it as part of life, and to think of it as part of life is to realize the extent of artifice. We live in the mind.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: I'm an emotional sort of person in general and I have a vivid imagination, so I feel the whole spectrum of emotion strongly when I write.
author: Erin Morgenstern

quote: My favorite literature to read is fairly dry history. I like the framework, and my imagination can do the rest.
author: Andrew Bird

quote: You have to just go with your imagination, where your instinct takes you.
author: Peter Mullan

quote: Your primary tools, as an actor, are observation and imagination. You can pretty much get everything you need from that, and you do. It brings back that element of pretend.
author: Stephen Lang

quote: On some level, acting is the art of pretend, and you have to have a highly cultivated sense of imagination. You have to be able to see things that aren't there, no matter what aspect of acting, whether it's green screen, whether it's on stage, whether it's anything else, whether you're working on the radio.
author: Stephen Lang

quote: The nomads' egalitarian lifestyle astonished the Greeks, who kept their own women indoors weaving and minding children. The exotic Scythian lifestyle fueled the Greek imagination and led to an outpouring of myths about fierce Amazons, 'the equals of men.'
author: Adrienne Mayor

quote: We know their names: Hippolyta, Antiope, Thessalia. But they were long thought to be just travelers' tales or products of the Greek storytelling imagination. A lot of scholars still argue that. But archaeology has now proven without a doubt that there really were women fitting the description that the Greeks gave us of Amazons and warrior women.
author: Adrienne Mayor

quote: The opportunities of man are limited only by his imagination. But so few have imagination that there are ten thousand fiddlers to one composer.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: Ideas control the world.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: In an era of parental paranoia, lawsuit mania and testing frenzy, we are failing to inspire our children's curiosity, creativity, and imagination. We are denying them opportunities to tinker, discover, and explore - in short, to play.
author: Darell Hammond

quote: Ultimately, so much Dr. Seuss is about empowerment. He invites us to disappear into our imagination and then blows the doors off what that can mean.
author: Gary Ross

quote: Imagination creates some big monsters.
author: Olivier Martinez

quote: A young imagination is bold, likes to make bigger leaps. It likes to, well, imagine that the dustbuster is a dinosaur; that the computer mouse is a hotrod; that the box is a cave; that the rawhide is a torch... or a baton... or something.
author: Mo Rocca

quote: I like to build a character, trying to stretch my imagination as far to the walls of my brain as I can to come up with something that feels truthful and feels real - as close to the skin as I can get it.
author: Uzo Aduba

quote: I think of myself as a little kid, and I had a wild imagination, but it was something that was encouraged and supported, which helped steer me into the arts.
author: Uzo Aduba

quote: Love is based on imagination.
author: Olivier Martinez

quote: But in my imagination this whole thing developed and I started mixing up old folk songs with the Beatles beat and taking them down to Greenwich Village and playing them for the people there.
author: Roger McGuinn

quote: I sort of jumped out of movies and into the lifeboat of comics. I loved it right away. It was the opposite of film school. Whatever was in my imagination could end up in the finished product. There were just no limitations.
author: Brian K. Vaughan

quote: That was the appealing thing about comics: There literally is no budget in comics. You're only limited by your imagination.
author: Brian K. Vaughan

quote: Let's be clear - for people like me, who are obsessed with story and for whom words are their medium, writing is the best job possible. I work hard, but I earn more than the national average wage while I play with my imagination, and for me, that's a dream.
author: Sara Sheridan

quote: I used to write stories a lot because you had to fill your hours some other way than watching television. So my imagination was vivid, and I used to write a lot of stories. I wrote a novel, which I still have, which is so awful.
author: Robert Osborne

quote: Imagination is not the exclusive appanage of artists, but belongs in varying degrees to all men.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Philosophy and Art both render the invisible visible by imagination.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Clearly, some creative thinking is badly needed if humans are to have a future beyond Earth. Returning to the Moon may be worthy and attainable, but it fails to capture the public's imagination. What does get people excited is the prospect of a mission to Mars.
author: Paul Davies

quote: I feel like the Internet needs to be disarmed in some way. There needs to be a philosophical undermining of the Internet. We take it too seriously and too literally. For a reference we go to Wikipedia, which is full of inaccuracies and misinformation. It's kind of beautiful - it's all the product of imagination; it's not reality at all.
author: Sufjan Stevens

quote: When I start a picture, I always have a script, but I change it every day. I put in what occurs to me that day out of my imagination. You start on a voyage; you know where you will end up but not what will occur along the way. You want to be surprised.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: You will obtain a vision of matter that is perhaps fatiguing for your imagination, but pure and stripped of what the requirements of life make you add to it in external perception.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: Classical plays require more imagination and more general training to be able to do. That's why I like playing Shakespeare better than anything else.
author: Vivien Leigh

quote: I do not 'get' ideas ideas get me.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: All art, from the paintings on the walls of cave dwellers to art created today, is autobiographical because it comes from the secret place in the soul where imagination resides.
author: Gloria Vanderbilt

quote: We imagine that we want to escape our selfish and commonplace existence, but we cling desperately to our chains.
author: Anne Sullivan

quote: Trust that little voice in your head that says 'Wouldn't it be interesting if...' And then do it.
author: Duane Michals

quote: I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
author: Duane Michals

quote: In my imagination yes, I remember, when I was six years old, I was conducting all this concert in my house. But now it's real.
author: Gustavo Dudamel

quote: The peculiar fascination which the South held over my imagination and my limited capital decided me in favor of Atlanta University so about the last of September I bade farewell to the friends and scenes of my boyhood and boarded a train for the South.
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: Suffering, it turns out, demands profound imagination. A new future has to be conjured up because the old future isn't there anymore.
author: Rob Bell

quote: I have an imagination because my life is so boring that my imagination lets me get off the reality of what's going on.
author: Dave Attell

quote: I used to lie in bed in my flat and imagine what would happen if there was a zombie attack.
author: Simon Pegg

quote: You need imagination in order to imagine a future that doesn't exist.
author: Azar Nafisi

quote: I try to decorate my imagination as much as I can.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: What does it mean to be Catholic and not a Catholic? I feel adrift, homeless. My Catholic imagination allows me to see the soul as a lit breath, seeking the divine. It persists.
author: Julianna Baggott

quote: I am putting real plums into an imaginary cake.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: The violent quarrel between the abstractionists and the surrealists seems to me quite unnecessary. All good art has contained both abstract and surrealist elements, just as it has contained both classical and romantic elements - order and surprise, intellect and imagination, conscious and unconscious.
author: Henry Moore

quote: From a very young age, stories fuelled my imagination in the most wonderful way.
author: Hayley Atwell

quote: We are all afraid for our confidence, for the future, for the world. That is the nature of the human imagination. Yet every man, every civilization, has gone forward because of its engagement with what it has set itself to do.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Predating the Internet and predating videos, you had an active imagination. You would hear sounds and then get mental pictures of what these sounds felt like to you. It engaged you and made you more invested in it. It made you want to get tickets to the show, buy the album, put the poster on the wall. Now it's sensory overload.
author: Q-Tip

quote: I grew up in Sierra Leone, in a small village where as a boy my imagination was sparked by the oral tradition of storytelling. At a very young age I learned the importance of telling stories - I saw that stories are the most potent way of seeing anything we encounter in our lives, and how we can deal with living.
author: Ishmael Beah

quote: For imagination sets the goal picture which our automatic mechanism works on. We act, or fail to act, not because of will, as is so commonly believed, but because of imagination.
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: Vision is the true creative rhythm.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: Then I decided to draw from and on my own imagination, and everything came out perfect.
author: Jack Prelutsky

quote: We have the universe to roam in in imagination. It is our virtue to be infinitely varied. The worst tyranny is uniformity.
author: George William Russell

quote: History releases me from my own experience and jogs my fictional imagination.
author: Jennifer Gilmore

quote: Imagination is at the root of much that passes for love.
author: Gilbert Parker

quote: A person possessed with an idea cannot be reasoned with.
author: James Anthony Froude

quote: Writing for children isn't easy. Kids will abandon a story that doesn't interest, enchant, delight, thrill, or terrify them. But when you can find a way into a young reader's imagination through something as simple as words on paper, well, there's nothing more satisfying.
author: Kate Klise

quote: I've always had this in a kind of worst-case dark imagination. I want to know what the dark form in the window is. I want to know what the noise under the staircase is.
author: Lisa Unger

quote: I had been a reporter for 15 years when I set out to write my first novel. I knew how to research an article or profile a subject - skills that I assumed would be useless when it came to fiction. It was from my imagination that the characters in my story would emerge.
author: Amy Waldman

quote: Children do not give up their innate imagination, curiosity, dreaminess easily. You have to love them to get them to do that.
author: R. D. Laing

quote: My mother was making $135 a week, but she had resilience and imagination. She might take frozen vegetables, cook them with garlic, onion and Spam, and it would taste like a four-star dinner.
author: Andre Dubus III

quote: No, no, I don't watch football. The last time I tried watching was the last Super Bowl. The problem I have is, you know, the graphic nature of my imagination; when I watch and see them meeting head onto head, helmet onto helmet, what flashes through my mind is what's going on in their brains. It's like torture to me.
author: Bennet Omalu

quote: I love using my imagination. I love writing about animals.
author: Mary Pope Osborne

quote: I am imagination. I can see what the eyes cannot see. I can hear what the ears cannot hear. I can feel what the heart cannot feel.
author: Peter Nivio Zarlenga

quote: Never forget that the key to the situation lies in the will and not in the imagination.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: The American imagination has never been able to fully recover from its white-supremacist beginnings.
author: Claudia Rankine

quote: I have a darker imagination than most people.
author: Edan Lepucki

quote: Writers to some extent are childish, and it's at the childish level that one really engages with any experience. What really moves you is at the very personal, childish level of the imagination. My business is the imagination, and my imagination is engaged by Asia.
author: Christopher Koch

quote: Each one seems to be, in some way, essentially different from the others, and each is a surprise to me. I think that making books, or any kind of art, might also be like mining. The artist digs into his or her life and imagination and never knows what they'll find. That's the adventure.
author: Mordicai Gerstein

quote: I love the paranormal, because there, every genre I write can become one beacon for my imagination.
author: Leslie Banks

quote: Imagination is an instrument of survival.
author: Rogier van der Heide

quote: Imagination, the traitor of the mind, has taken my solitude and slain it.
author: Robinson Jeffers

quote: The imagination is a pretty precious source of protection.
author: Nicholas Ray

quote: Dreaming is an act of pure imagination, attesting in all men a creative power, which if it were available in waking, would make every man a Dante or Shakespeare.
author: Frederick Henry Hedge

quote: I consider myself very fortunate indeed to have created a character which has captured the imagination and enthusiasm of so many children worldwide. They are my family, and Spot belongs to them all.
author: Eric Hill

quote: Nowadays people's visual imagination is so much more sophisticated, so much more developed, particularly in young people, that now you can make an image which just slightly suggests something, they can make of it what they will.
author: Robert Doisneau

quote: I want to be on the screen, I want to play dress up every day, I want be different people, I want to have fun, and I want to use my imagination.
author: Skyler Samuels

quote: I am better able to imagine hell than heaven; it is my inheritance, I suppose.
author: Elinor Wylie

quote: Life would have been absolutely empty without imagination.
author: Jack Williamson

quote: My eyes were made to erase all that is ugly.
author: Raoul Dufy

quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Art is the daughter of freedom.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Art is not a thing it is a way.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: My painting does not come from the easel.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Art is not a handicraft, it is the transmission of feeling the artist has experienced.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don't have for something they don't need.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Creative without strategy is called 'art.' Creative with strategy is called 'advertising.'
author: Jef I. Richards

quote: I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
author: Ernst Fischer

quote: Where there is no human connection, there is no compassion. Without compassion, then community, commitment, loving-kindness, human understanding, and peace all shrivel. Individuals become isolated, the isolated turn cruel, and the tragic hovers in the forms of domestic and civil violence. Art and literature are antidotes to that.
author: Susan Vreeland

quote: Every human is an artist. And this is the main art that we have: the creation of our story.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: A picture is a poem without words.
author: Horace

quote: The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Insight is the first condition of Art.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Art is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The true artist is not proud: he unfortunately sees that art has no limits; he feels darkly how far he is from the goal, and though he may be admired by others, he is sad not to have reached that point to which his better genius only appears as a distant, guiding sun.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.
author: Claude Monet

quote: Every painting is a voyage into a sacred harbour.
author: Giotto di Bondone

quote: Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.
author: George Sand

quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: I'm giving into my tendency to want to blur and blend the lines between art and life, and privacy and sharing.
author: Lia Ices

quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

quote: To say the word Romanticism is to say modern art - that is, intimacy, spirituality, color, aspiration towards the infinite, expressed by every means available to the arts.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: To me, photography is an art of observation. It's about finding something interesting in an ordinary place... I've found it has little to do with the things you see and everything to do with the way you see them.
author: Elliott Erwitt

quote: Art is the most beautiful of all lies.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: Inspiration comes from everywhere: books, art, people on the street. It is an interior process for me.
author: Colleen Atwood

quote: If you're not trying to be real, you don't have to get it right. That's art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: In art, there is no need for color; I see only light and shade. Give me a crayon, and I will paint your portrait.
author: Francisco Goya

quote: There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing. Defeat means to defeat the mind of contention that we harbor within.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: I don't think about art when I'm working. I try to think about life.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quote: A museum is a spiritual place. People lower their voices when they get close to art.
author: Mario Botta

quote: Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.
author: Plato

quote: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.
author: Georg Cantor

quote: It's very important that we re-learn the art of resting and relaxing. Not only does it help prevent the onset of many illnesses that develop through chronic tension and worrying; it allows us to clear our minds, focus, and find creative solutions to problems.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'Nice doggie' until you can find a rock.
author: Will Rogers

quote: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The wonders of the Grand Canyon cannot be adequately represented in symbols of speech, nor by speech itself. The resources of the graphic art are taxed beyond their powers in attempting to portray its features. Language and illustration combined must fail.
author: John Wesley Powell

quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: Art should be an oasis: a place or refuge from the hardness of life.
author: Fernando Botero

quote: The walls between art and engineering exist only in our minds.
author: Theo Jansen

quote: Because advertising and marketing is an art, the solution to each new problem or challenge should begin with a blank canvas and an open mind, not with the nervous borrowings of other people's mediocrities. That's precisely what 'trends' are - a search for something 'safe' - and why a reliance on them leads to oblivion.
author: George Lois

quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: I like to change. A new lamp, a piece of art, can transform a room.
author: Madonna Ciccone

quote: There will be very few occasions when you are absolutely certain about anything. You will consistently be called upon to make decisions with limited information. That being the case, your goal should not be to eliminate uncertainty. Instead, you must develop the art of being clear in the face of uncertainty.
author: Andy Stanley

quote: I never know what I'm going to put on the canvas. The canvas paints itself. I'm just the middleman.
author: Peter Max

quote: Well, Art is Art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water. And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now you tell me what you know.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The study of the art of motorcycle maintenance is really a miniature study of the art of rationality itself. Working on a motorcycle, working well, caring, is to become part of a process, to achieve an inner peace of mind. The motorcycle is primarily a mental phenomenon.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: I believe the target of anything in life should be to do it so well that it becomes an art.
author: Arsene Wenger

quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Animation is not the art of drawings that move but the art of movements that are drawn.
author: Norman McLaren

quote: Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: Art is the window to man's soul. Without it, he would never be able to see beyond his immediate world; nor could the world see the man within.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: An artist must be free to choose what he does, certainly, but he must also never be afraid to do what he might choose.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Art! Who comprehends her? With whom can one consult concerning this great goddess?
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without the thorn.
author: Martin Amis

quote: The strangeness will wear off and I think we will discover the deeper meanings in modern art.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
author: John Singer Sargent

quote: The cinema is not a craft. It is an art. It does not mean teamwork. One is always alone on the set as before the blank page. And to be alone... means to ask questions. And to make films means to answer them.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: There are no rules. That is how art is born, how breakthroughs happen. Go against the rules or ignore the rules. That is what invention is about.
author: Helen Frankenthaler

quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene, and, as if by magic, we see a new meaning in it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Everyone discusses my art and pretends to understand, as if it were necessary to understand, when it is simply necessary to love.
author: Claude Monet

quote: Simplicity and repose are the qualities that measure the true value of any work of art.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: My art originates from hallucinations only I can see. I translate the hallucinations and obsessional images that plague me into sculptures and paintings.
author: Yayoi Kusama

quote: The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
author: Eugene Delacroix

quote: What art is, in reality, is this missing link, not the links which exist. It's not what you see that is art; art is the gap.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: With just one polka dot, nothing can be achieved. In the universe, there is the sun, the moon, the earth, and hundreds of millions of stars. All of us live in the unfathomable mystery and infinitude of the universe. Pursuing 'philosophy of the universe' through art under such circumstances has led me to what I call 'stereotypical repetition.'
author: Yayoi Kusama

quote: In art, at a certain level, there is no 'better than.' It's just about trying to operate for yourself on the most supreme level, artistically, that you can and hoping that people get it. Trusting that, just because of the way people are built and how interconnected we are, greatness will translate and symmetry will be recognised.
author: Frank Ocean

quote: A picture book is a small door to the enormous world of the visual arts, and they're often the first art a young person sees.
author: Tomie dePaola

quote: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: Art doesn't transform. It just plain forms.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: All art is erotic.
author: Gustav Klimt

quote: There is only one valuable thing in art: the thing you cannot explain.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.
author: Aristotle

quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.
author: Rebecca West

quote: There is nothing new in art except talent.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Should graffiti be judged on the same level as modern art? Of course not: It's way more important than that.
author: Banksy

quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Politicians are masters of the art of deception.
author: Martin L. Gross

quote: I try to keep a low profile in general. Not with my art, but just as a person.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: For as long as I can remember I have suffered from a deep feeling of anxiety which I have tried to express in my art.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
author: Russell Simmons

quote: A sculptor is a person who is interested in the shape of things, a poet in words, a musician by sounds.
author: Henry Moore

quote: What is comedy? Comedy is the art of making people laugh without making them puke.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Abstract art: a product of the untalented sold by the unprincipled to the utterly bewildered.
author: Al Capp

quote: It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.
author: Robert Schumann

quote: The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Art evokes the mystery without which the world would not exist.
author: Rene Magritte

quote: What is Art? It is the response of man's creative soul to the call of the Real.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Errors are not in the art but in the artificers.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: For me, there is very little difference between magic and art. To me, the ultimate act of magic is to create something from nothing: It's like when the stage magician pulls the rabbit from the hat.
author: Alan Moore

quote: I always saw candy as art.
author: Dylan Lauren

quote: The art of doing mathematics consists in finding that special case which contains all the germs of generality.
author: David Hilbert

quote: When hospitality becomes an art it loses its very soul.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: When thou art at Rome, do as they do at Rome.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Art can only be truly art by presenting an adequate outward symbol of some fact in the interior life.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Cleanliness is the scourge of art.
author: Craig Brown

quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.
author: Epicurus

quote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Violin playing is a physical art with great traditions behind it.
author: Vanessa Mae

quote: To curb the machine and limit art to handicraft is a denial of opportunity.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: I don't listen to what art critics say. I don't know anybody who needs a critic to find out what art is.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quote: Art does not reproduce what we see; rather, it makes us see.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Use the creative process - singing, writing, art, dance, whatever - to get to know yourself better.
author: Catie Curtis

quote: There's traditionally been a large disconnection in contemporary art between the audience and the artist. Generally, audiences are looking towards what they like, and I can tell you, that's the last thing on an artist's mind.
author: James Turrell

quote: London, thou art the flower of cities all!
author: William Dunbar

quote: Art is the fatal net which catches these strange moments on the wing like mysterious butterflies, fleeing the innocence and distraction of common men.
author: Giorgio de Chirico

quote: Through a painting we can see the whole world.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: The art of photography is all about directing the attention of the viewer.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: Photographing a cake can be art.
author: Irving Penn

quote: What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Art is about building a new foundation, not just laying something on top of what's already there.
author: Prince

quote: I don't like to say I have given my life to art. I prefer to say art has given me my life.
author: Frank Stella

quote: Art begins in imitation and ends in innovation.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Art is born of humiliation.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Art resides in the quality of doing, process is not magic.
author: Charles Eames

quote: I just love pretty things, whether it is art, a song or a pair of shoes.
author: Rita Ora

quote: A work of art that contains theories is like an object on which the price tag has been left.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Life is short, the art long.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Art, in itself, is an attempt to bring order out of chaos.
author: Stephen Sondheim

quote: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: I consider skateboarding an art form, a lifestyle and a sport. 'Action sport' would be the least offensive categorization.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice.
author: Henry Louis Gates

quote: Art is not supposed to change the world, to change practical things, but to change perceptions. Art can change the way we see the world. Art can create an analogy.
author: JR

quote: People discuss my art and pretend to understand as if it were necessary to understand, when it's simply necessary to love.
author: Claude Monet

quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
author: Gunter Grass

quote: My daughter loves to do art stuff. As a father, I like to play with her. We break out the big pads of paper and the glitter and all the stuff. She likes to do what she likes to do. I want to do something, too. So I've just started using her same materials - a lot of crayons, a lot of sparkle, charcoal, pencils, markers and glue.
author: Stone Gossard

quote: Parks are works of art just as a painting or sculpture is.
author: Thomas Hoving

quote: Art is the elimination of the unnecessary.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Art challenges technology, but technology inspires the art.
author: John Lasseter

quote: My art is not limited to the songs I create but also to the reaction it creates. I like to sit back and look at the whole thing as if it's a tornado that I'm controlling. It's creating chaos. When you create chaos, ideas are turned upside down, and everybody looks at things in a different way.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: What goes on in abstract art is the proclaiming of aesthetic principles... It is in our own time that we have become aware of pure aesthetic considerations. Art never can be imitation.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: Diplomacy, n. is the art of letting somebody else have your way.
author: David Frost

quote: Encouraging young people to believe in themselves and find their own voice whether it's through writing, drama or art is so important in giving young people a sense of self-worth.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: I think that art is still a site for resistance and for the telling of various stories, for validating certain subjectivities we normally overlook. I'm trying to be affective, to suggest changes, and to resist what I feel are the tyrannies of social life on a certain level.
author: Barbara Kruger

quote: I paint; I draw and paint - I've been doing that since I was in third grade, drawing realistically and then changing to abstract art. That was my first creative thing before guitar or comedy.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Art is interesting because there can be so many different perspectives in a piece of art. The way I see it may be completely different than the way somebody else sees it. It's interesting to hear what somebody sees in a piece of art compared to somebody else. It could be completely different, and that's interesting to me.
author: Joakim Noah

quote: I do not regard advertising as entertainment or an art form, but as a medium of information.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
author: Truman Capote

quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.
author: Ludwig Erhard

quote: I did study the art of being a barber because I wanted to figure out what my routine would be. Do you start in the front or back? Top or bottom? Swivel the chair or walk around? What I did discover is there's no such thing as the perfect haircut!
author: Sean Patrick Thomas

quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: When I am finishing a picture, I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it's bad art.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: I think it's the pain and suffering that drive you to become an artist. The art itself should be the pain, sort of exorcising every demon and making you feel like you're a person that matters.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: Art is the path to being spiritual.
author: Piet Mondrian

quote: It is Homer who has chiefly taught other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
author: Aristotle

quote: Art is the provocation for talking about enigma and the search for sense in human life. One can do that by telling a story or writing about a fresco by Giotto or studying how a snail climbs up a wall.
author: John Berger

quote: When the bright angel dominates, out comes a great work of art, a Michelangelo David or a Beethoven symphony.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest people uneasy is the best bred in the room.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The orbit of human vision has widened and art has annexed fresh territories that were formerly denied to it.
author: Max Bill

quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I've been called many names like perfectionist, difficult and obsessive. I think it takes obsession, takes searching for the details for any artist to be good.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The art of motherhood involves much silent, unobtrusive self-denial, an hourly devotion which finds no detail too minute.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Our individual lives cannot, generally, be works of art unless the social order is also.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: I paint with shapes.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: I really believe there are things nobody would see if I didn't photograph them.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: A beautiful body perishes, but a work of art dies not.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Art hurts. Art urges voyages - and it is easier to stay at home.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Venice is the perfect place for a phase of art to die. No other city on earth embraces entropy quite like this magical floating mall.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: If my art has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?
author: Ai Weiwei

quote: I am interested in mathematics only as a creative art.
author: G. H. Hardy

quote: Democracy is the art of thinking independently together.
author: Alexander Meiklejohn

quote: Art is to me the glorification of the human spirit, and as such it is the cultural documentation of the time in which it is produced.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: I come from a real working class background, and I didn't know anyone sophisticated - except I saw Edie Sedgewick once at the Art Museum in Philly. She had these black leotards and little black pumps and this big ermine cape and all these white dogs and black sunglasses and black eyes. She was classy!
author: Patti Smith

quote: Art is moral passion married to entertainment. Moral passion without entertainment is propaganda, and entertainment without moral passion is television.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: The most momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Guided only by their feeling for symmetry, simplicity, and generality, and an indefinable sense of the fitness of things, creative mathematicians now, as in the past, are inspired by the art of mathematics rather than by any prospect of ultimate usefulness.
author: E. T. Bell

quote: Postmodernism surely requires an even greater grasp of symbolism, as it's increasingly an art of gesture alone.
author: Andrew Eldritch

quote: So vast is art, so narrow human wit.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
author: Carl Rogers

quote: That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
author: Corita Kent

quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.
author: George Santayana

quote: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Once an object has been incorporated in a picture it accepts a new destiny.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I don't paint things. I only paint the difference between things.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: In art the best is good enough.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Art is the triumph over chaos.
author: John Cheever

quote: Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.
author: Paul Strand

quote: Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.
author: Peter De Vries

quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: All good art is an indiscretion.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
author: William Morris

quote: I rarely draw what I see. I draw what I feel in my body.
author: Barbara Hepworth

quote: Be careful that you do not write or paint anything that is not your own, that you don't know in your own soul.
author: Emily Carr

quote: A painting that is well composed is half finished.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: Layer by layer art strips life bare.
author: Robert Musil

quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: The philistine provides the best definition of art. Anything that makes him rage is first class.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: Artists live in unknown spaces and give themselves over to following something unknown.
author: Kiki Smith

quote: The art of delegation is one of the key skills any entrepreneur must master.
author: Richard Branson

quote: You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
author: Nicki Minaj

quote: In general, the art of government consists of taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
author: Voltaire

quote: The artist must create a spark before he can make a fire and before art is born, the artist must be ready to be consumed by the fire of his own creation.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The essential function of art is moral. But a passionate, implicit morality, not didactic. A morality which changes the blood, rather than the mind.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Art should be created for life, not for the museum.
author: Jean Nouvel

quote: There's not a lot of art forms where you can control your presentation and your ideas.
author: Gerard Way

quote: If trees can create art, if they can encircle the globe seven times in one year, if prisoners can grow plants and raise frogs, then perhaps there are other static entities that we hold inside ourselves, like grief, like addictions, like racism, that can also change.
author: Nalini Nadkarni

quote: The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: The old, sad art colors are gone. Now I paint bright colors. I paint paintings which are happy, where children are laughing and playing with animals. I paint paradise on Earth. I still paint sadness sometimes, but there is sadness in the world, too.
author: Margaret Keane

quote: Dying is an art, like everything else. I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I've a call.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.
author: Albrecht Durer

quote: Disco deserved a better name, a beautiful name because it was a beautiful art form. It made the consumer beautiful. The consumer was the star.
author: Barry White

quote: Ethics is in origin the art of recommending to others the sacrifices required for cooperation with oneself.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: I've learned that I'm most powerful when I'm doing my art.
author: Andre Benjamin

quote: When you create art, the world has to wait.
author: Will Smith

quote: Art's a very metaphysical activity. It's something that enriches the parameters of your life, the possibilities of being, and you touch transcendence and you change your life. And you want to change the life of others, too. That's why people are involved with art.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: So many gods, so many creeds, so many paths that wind and wind while just the art of being kind is all the sad world needs.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: The only honest art form is laughter, comedy. You can't fake it... try to fake three laughs in an hour - ha ha ha ha ha - they'll take you away, man. You can't.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: If thou art a man, admire those who attempt great things, even though they fail.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: I think we're much smarter than we were. Everybody knows that abstract art can be art, and most people know that they may not like it, even if they understand there's another purpose to it.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: Pop art is the inedible raised to the unspeakable.
author: Leonard Baskin

quote: Yes, I believe that the art of winning is through intimidation, and not necessarily do you have to speak about it.
author: Mark Spitz

quote: The body is your instrument in dance, but your art is outside that creature, the body.
author: Martha Graham

quote: The sadness of the incomplete, the sadness that is often Life, but should never be Art.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Art is based on emotion, but being macho is based on ego; the wall protecting that emotion.
author: Miguel

quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.
author: Banksy

quote: When I go to an art gallery and stand in front of a painting, I don't want someone telling me what I should be seeing or thinking; I want to feel whatever I feel, see whatever I see, and figure out what I figure out.
author: James Frey

quote: I make static art, not dynamic art. That's what I do.
author: Michael Heizer

quote: I love that works of art are printed so that anyone can buy them. The variety of what they put on little postcards astounds me.
author: Leonard Lauder

quote: I don't believe in the school of hard knocks, although I've had them. All that stuff about whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger is so not true. Do you know what makes you stronger? When people treat you and your art with dignity.
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: The job of art is to chase ugliness away.
author: Bono

quote: Art is for healing ourselves, and everybody needs their own personal art to heal up their problems.
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: Until I began to learn to draw, I was never much interested in looking at art.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: Back in third grade, they used to say, 'Take whatever talent you have and think of something you can do with it.' I liked to draw, but what could I do with it? Maybe I could be an art dealer - nah, can't see myself doing that. Maybe I could do commercial arts?
author: The Notorious B.I.G.

quote: All the great works of art, the cathedrals - the Gothic cathedrals and the splendid Baroque churches - are a luminous sign of God, and thus are truly a manifestation, an epiphany of God.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Every great work of art has two faces, one toward its own time and one toward the future, toward eternity.
author: Lester Bangs

quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Where thou art, that is home.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The challenge is to practice politics as the art of making what appears to be impossible, possible.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

quote: Art is much less important than life, but what a poor life without it.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: The notion that the public accepts or rejects anything in modern art is merely romantic fiction. The game is completed and the trophies distributed long before the public knows what has happened.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: The greater the decrease in the social significance of an art form, the sharper the distinction between criticism and enjoyment by the public. The conventional is uncritically enjoyed, and the truly new is criticized with aversion.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: They say Princes learn no art truly, but the art of horsemanship. The reason is, the brave beast is no flatterer. He will throw a prince as soon as his groom.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Nothing right can be accomplished in art without enthusiasm.
author: Robert Schumann

quote: Good art however 'immoral' is wholly a thing of virtue. Good art can NOT be immoral. By good art I mean art that bears true witness, I mean the art that is most precise.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: If a patron buys from an artist who needs money, the patron then makes himself equal to the artist; he is building art into the world; he creates.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art.
author: Henry James

quote: It is not hard to understand modern art. If it hangs on a wall it's a painting, and if you can walk around it it's a sculpture.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: The forms of art are inexhaustible but all lead by the same road of aesthetic emotion to the same world of aesthetic ecstasy.
author: Clive Bell

quote: Everything that is strong in me has gone into my art work.
author: Robert Crumb

quote: It's an art to live with pain... mix the light into gray.
author: Eddie Vedder

quote: Oh literature, oh the glorious Art, how it preys upon the marrow in our bones. It scoops the stuffing out of us, and chucks us aside. Alas!
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: All the world old is queer save thee and me, and even thou art a little queer.
author: Robert Owen

quote: No art is any good unless you can feel how it's put together. By and large it's the eye, the hand and if it's any good, you feel the body. Most of the best stuff seems to be a complete gesture, the totality of the artist's body; you can really lean on it.
author: Frank Stella

quote: The arts equally have distinct departments, and unless photography has its own possibilities of expression, separate from those of the other arts, it is merely a process, not an art.
author: Alfred Stieglitz

quote: Painting is an essentially concrete art and can only consist of the representation of real and existing things.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: I think art is inherently nonviolent and it actually occupies your mind with creation rather than destruction.
author: Anthony Kiedis

quote: In any art, you don't know in advance what you want to say - it's revealed to you as you say it. That's the difference between art and illustration.
author: Aaron Siskind

quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Tell me thy company, and I'll tell thee what thou art.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I think body-image issues are not just a dancer thing. I think we're much more in tune and aware because the body is our instrument and art, and we stare at ourselves in a mirror all day, but I feel like it's something that every woman experiences and every girl experiences.
author: Misty Copeland

quote: It was Public Art, defined as art that is purchased by experts who are not spending their own personal money.
author: Dave Barry

quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Art for art's sake is a philosophy of the well-fed.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: What was any art but a mould in which to imprison for a moment the shining elusive element which is life itself - life hurrying past us and running away, too strong to stop, too sweet to lose.
author: Willa Cather

quote: The art of being a slave is to rule one's master.
author: Diogenes

quote: What marks the artist is his power to shape the material of pain we all have.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
author: Jerzy Kosinski

quote: With color one obtains an energy that seems to stem from witchcraft.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: Art gives people a reason to be alive.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: The concept of commercialism in the fashion and art world is looked down upon. You know, just to think, 'What amount of creativity does it take to make something that masses of people like?' And, 'How does creativity apply across the board?'
author: Kanye West

quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Cinema is an art form that is designed to go across borders. And as a filmmaker, the only way I can direct a movie is when I feel close to my culture.
author: Denis Villeneuve

quote: I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: In art, the obvious is a sin.
author: Edward Dmytryk

quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
author: James Whistler

quote: Jazz is known all over the world as an American musical art form and that's it. No America, no jazz. I've seen people try to connect it to other countries, for instance to Africa, but it doesn't have a damn thing to do with Africa.
author: Art Blakey

quote: The word 'art' interests me very much. If it comes from Sanskrit, as I've heard, it signifies 'making.' Now everyone makes something, and those who make things on a canvas with a frame, they're called artists. Formerly, they were called craftsmen, a term I prefer. We're all craftsmen, in civilian or military or artistic life.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: As humans we look at things and think about what we've looked at. We treasure it in a kind of private art gallery.
author: Thom Gunn

quote: Enjoying art is a personal matter. It's made up by contemplation, silence, abstraction.
author: Renzo Piano

quote: The sole art that suits me is that which, rising from unrest, tends toward serenity.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The work of art is a scream of freedom.
author: Christo

quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Architects, sculptors painters, we all must return to the crafts! For art is not a 'profession.' There is no essential difference between the artist and the craftsman. The artist is an exalted craftsman.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: To catch a husband is an art to hold him is a job.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The art of living is the art of knowing how to believe lies.
