quote: Politics is repetition. It is not change. Change is something beyond what we call politics. Change is the essence politics is supposed to be the means to bring into being.
author: Kate Millett

quote: One of the things being in politics has taught me is that men are not a reasoned or reasonable sex.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Politics and government are certainly among the most important of practical human interests.
author: P. T. Barnum

quote: There is so much partisan and tribal politics, from not just those seeking office but potential voters as well, that we never get real attempts at solutions to problems.
author: Mark Cuban

quote: More things in politics happen by accident or exhaustion than happen by conspiracy.
author: Jeff Greenfield

quote: To balance China, the democracies will need new friends - and India with its fast-growing economy, youthful population, and democratic politics seems the obvious candidate.
author: David Frum

quote: I was very aware of office politics because I was so baffled by them. So much so goes unsaid. No one says 'you're a cheeky so-and-so,' no one says 'you're so moody,' nobody ever confronts anyone else about anything. But I'm very crass, and I'm very confrontational, and I have a temper. I had to be hyper-vigilant in every office I worked in.
author: Denise Mina

quote: Whenever anything extraordinary is done in American municipal politics, whether for good or for evil, you can trace it almost invariably to one man. The people do not do it. Neither do the 'gangs,' 'combines,' or political parties.
author: Lincoln Steffens

quote: Hypocrisy is the scarlet letter in politics.
author: Mark McKinnon

quote: I am not God. Nor am I Phantom. I am ready to accept any criticism. I have been in politics for decades. Each and every day, in several media, there is criticism of me.
author: Mamata Banerjee

quote: In the political system, we are a team; politics and bureaucracy, we are a team. The politicians, bureaucrats and the people, we are a team.
author: Narendra Modi

quote: That's politics. After six o'clock, we can be friends, but before six, it's politics.
author: Thomas P. O'Neill

quote: Before I went to jail, I was active in politics as a member of South Africa's leading organization - and I was generally busy from 7 A.M. until midnight. I never had time to sit and think.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: As I prepare for this next phase in my life, I ask that people continue to offer the prayers that have protected me thus far. I also pray that I will always see those who are not seen and easy to forget in the hustle and bustle of Washington politics.
author: Artur Davis

quote: Power, in a nutshell, is the ability to get things done, and politics is the ability to decide which things need to be done.
author: Zygmunt Bauman

quote: Culture is about humanizing people. You look at the African-American civil rights movement, you look at the LGBT rights movement - the culture changed before the politics did.
author: Jose Antonio Vargas

quote: In order to become the master, the politician poses as the servant.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President I'm beginning to believe it.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: As you make your bed, so you must lie in it.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: The successful revolutionary is a statesman, the unsuccessful one a criminal.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Voters don't decide issues, they decide who will decide issues.
author: George Will

quote: Liberalism is, I think, resurgent. One reason is that more and more people are so painfully aware of the alternative.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: We live in a world in which politics has replaced philosophy.
author: Martin L. Gross

quote: Hell hath no fury like a bureaucrat scorned.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: There can be no wise politics without thought beforehand.
author: Annie Besant

quote: Every man who repeats the dogma of Mill that one country is no fit to rule another country must admit that one class is not fit to rule another class.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: There are no friends at cards or world politics.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: In every country today, there is politics. It may be authoritarian politics, but there is politics.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: I still love following and thinking about politics. I enjoy recommending important journalism I read or see from other sources.
author: Dan Rather

quote: If we lived within our means - by being prudent - the 7 billion people in the world could have everything they needed. Global politics should be moving in that direction. But we think as people and countries, not as a species.
author: Jose Mujica

quote: Ideas are great arrows, but there has to be a bow. And politics is the bow of idealism.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: Politics is the conspiracy of the unproductive but organized against the productive but unorganized.
author: Joseph Sobran

quote: Trying to take money out of politics is like trying to take jumping out of basketball.
author: Bill Bradley

quote: On the mountains mistakes are fatal. In politics, mistakes are wounding emotionally, but you recover. Personally, wilderness helps me get back in touch with natural rhythms, helps me reflect and, in the process, restore my creativity.
author: Mark Udall

quote: But I don't need to use politics as a way of making money.
author: Imran Khan

quote: Politics is about the improvement of people's lives. It's about advancing the cause of peace and justice in our country and the world. Politics is about doing well for the people.
author: Paul Wellstone

quote: One lesson you better learn if you want to be in politics is that you never go out on a golf course and beat the President.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Freedom and opportunity are precious gifts and the purpose of our politics is to expand them, for all our people.
author: Ed Miliband

quote: Politics with me isn't theater. It's performance art. Sometimes, for its own sake.
author: Roger Stone

quote: Those who write the editorials and those who write the columns, they simply are unaccountable. They're free to impose their cultural politics in the name of freedom of the press.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: I will go to the next election saying to Australians, vote for me, vote for the Liberal Party, and I will become your PM. So I'm offering myself as the alternative PM - that's one way people describe the Leader of the Opposition - but I'm not in politics for myself to realize a personal ambition.
author: Malcolm Turnbull

quote: I really don't have a lot of interest in national politics, and it's because I'm a skeptic. I think you can accomplish a lot more locally. I don't want to spin the wheels and not get anything done.
author: Ron Conway

quote: Politics is a love-hate relationship. I sure know that.
author: Richard Lamm

quote: A good Catholic meddles in politics, offering the best of himself, so that those who govern can govern. But what is the best that we can offer to those who govern? Prayer!
author: Pope Francis

quote: Politics, according to the Social Doctrine of the Church, is one of the highest forms of charity, because it serves the common good. I cannot wash my hands, eh? We all have to give something!
author: Pope Francis

quote: Not everybody is comfortable with the idea that politics is a guilty addiction. But it is.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: I don't like politics. I am not aligned to any political party. I have friends in all political parties.
author: Gautam Adani

quote: I stay out of politics because if I begin thinking too much about politics, I'll probably... drop writing children's books and become a political cartoonist again.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I worry about the direction of the U.K. and U.K. politics and governance in the event of a Brexit.
author: Nicola Sturgeon

quote: Politics organizes our lives. We can't disregard it. Politics has lot of muck, lot of dirt. But that doesn't mean you have to be away from it. It's ubiquitous.
author: Pawan Kalyan

quote: I'm sitting in my home office wearing a bathrobe. The same way I'm not going to start wearing ties, I'm also not going to buy into the fake politeness, the lying, the office politics and backstabbing, the passive aggressiveness, and the buzzwords.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Every artistic expression is either influenced by or adds something to politics.
author: Dario Fo

quote: Human evolution relies on cooperation, which is why identity politics feels so backward.
author: Greg Gutfeld

quote: Politics is almost as exciting as war, and quite as dangerous. In war you can only be killed once, but in politics many times.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Politics is a science. You can demonstrate that you are right and that others are wrong.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I think bad politics are incredibly dangerous, so it's important to make sure that people are communicating well. Culture and morale are super important. It's best to not force it, but let it happen organically and genuinely.
author: Aaron Levie

quote: Apparently, a democracy is a place where numerous elections are held at great cost without issues and with interchangeable candidates.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: It is necessary for me to establish a winner image. Therefore, I have to beat somebody.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: There are still people in my party who believe in consensus politics. I regard them as Quislings, as traitors... I mean it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Idealism is the despot of thought, just as politics is the despot of will.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: One thing I like about boxing is that I will not have to deal with the same kind of politics that I had to in skating. In boxing, it is not about your appearance, or how your costume looks, what color it is, or how much it costs.
author: Tonya Harding

quote: Boxing was not the sport that I thought is was due to all the politics.
author: Gerry Cooney

quote: When I came to Johannesburg from the countryside, I knew nobody, but many strangers were very kind to me. I then was dragged into politics, and then, subsequently, I became a lawyer.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Solidarity is the basis of my politics.
author: Douglas Alexander

quote: I know more about wheat and olive trees than I do about politics.
author: Ariel Sharon

quote: There is no gambling like politics.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: In politics it is necessary either to betray one's country or the electorate. I prefer to betray the electorate.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Oh, that lovely title, ex-president.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time.
author: E. B. White

quote: A week is a long time in politics.
author: Harold Wilson

quote: Every politician should have been born an orphan and remain a bachelor.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: Good government is good politics.
author: Richard J. Daley

quote: I paid too heavy a price for perestroika.
author: Mikhail Gorbachev

quote: The beef industry has contributed to more American deaths than all the wars of this century, all natural disasters, and all automobile accidents combined.
author: Neal Barnard

quote: The good news is that, according to the Obama administration, the rich will pay for everything. The bad news is that, according to the Obama administration, you're rich.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Do you ever get the feeling that the only reason we have elections is to find out if the polls were right?
author: Robert Orben

quote: Reporters thrive on the world's misfortune. For this reason they often take an indecent pleasure in events that dismay the rest of humanity.
author: Russell Baker

quote: It is difficult to discern a serious threat to religious liberty from a room of silent, thoughtful schoolchildren.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quote: Free speech is not to be regulated like diseased cattle and impure butter. The audience that hissed yesterday may applaud today, even for the same performance.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: Republicans have nothing but bad ideas and Democrats have no ideas.
author: Lewis Black

quote: There's a problem with political polling in that you have so much pressure to do what your client wants you to do and say what your client wants you to say. I've never felt that pressure. I am independent of the political parties.
author: Frank Luntz

quote: When the body of the people is possessed of the supreme power, it is called a democracy.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: In order to have your voice be heard in Washington, you have to make some little contribution.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Millions of Americans are standing up and saying, 'We want our country back!' Republicans, Democrats, Independents, will not go down the path of Greece, we will not go quietly into the night.
author: Ted Cruz

quote: Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think it's important.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: I happen to think that American politics is one of the noblest arts of mankind and I cannot do anything else but write about it.
author: Theodore White

quote: Would that the simple maxim, that honesty is the best policy, might be laid to heart; that a sense of the true aim of life might elevate the tone of politics and trade till public and private honor become identical.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: From politics, it was an easy step to silence.
author: Jane Austen

quote: When I entered politics, I took the only downward turn you could take from journalism.
author: Jim Hightower

quote: I seldom think of politics more than eighteen hours a day.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Life is a corrupting process from the time a child learns to play his mother off against his father in the politics of when to go to bed he who fears corruption fears life.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: Motivated more by partisan politics than by national security, today's Democratic leaders see America as an occupier, not a liberator. And nothing makes this Marine madder than someone calling American troops occupiers rather than liberators.
author: Zell Miller

quote: I don't believe in gutter politics. I don't believe in gutter journalism.
author: Maria Shriver

quote: Working together during the past three years, we have confounded the skeptics and the cynics. We've shown that here in Virginia, Democrats and Republicans can come together, put politics aside, and make tough decisions when times demand it.
author: Mark Warner

quote: My politics are of a practical kind - the integrity of the country, the supremacy of the Federal government, an honorable peace, or none at all.
author: Winfield Scott Hancock

quote: What matters most in politics is personality. It's not issues it's not image. It's who you are and what you represent.
author: Frank Luntz

quote: Politics can be likened to driving at night over unfamiliar hills and mountains. Close attention must be paid to what the beam can reach and the next bend.
author: David Trimble

quote: I think that what most surprises anybody who goes into politics from even a modestly cerebral background is the vulgarity of much of the cut and thrust of politics.
author: Chris Patten

quote: I follow politics, but I don't like to discuss it.
author: Tom Araya

quote: I think things changed as a result of a certain perception of our politics. When we went through our zealous, self-righteous period it didn't exactly win us any friends.
author: Fred Frith

quote: So the major obstacle to the development of new supplies is not geology but what happens above ground: international affairs, politics, investment and technology.
author: Daniel Yergin

quote: We can and must move U.S. politics forward by means of committed participation.
author: Paul Wellstone

quote: Men enter local politics solely as a result of being unhappily married.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quote: There are no generalizations in American politics that vested selfishness cannot cut through.
author: John Gunther

quote: The practice of politics in the East may be defined by one word: dissimulation.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Politics begin where the masses are, not where there are thousands, but where there are millions, that is where serious politics begin.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: I'm always rather nervous about how you talk about women who are active in politics, whether they want to be talked about as women or as politicians.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Politics follows the lines of physics: every action creates an equal and opposite reaction.
author: John Avlon

quote: And yet, there are still people in American politics who, for some reason, cling to this belief that America is better off adopting the economic policies of nations whose people who immigrate here from there.
author: Marco Rubio

quote: I think the fact is that anybody who goes into politics feels like 'I can make a difference'. But it's not one person, you need so many others.
author: Drew Brees

quote: I could have made a fortune in cheeseburgers, but I finally chose politics.
author: Francois Hollande

quote: I did not resign from politics because of Bofors. I resigned because I do not know how to play petty politics. I did not know back then and I don't know now either.
author: Amitabh Bachchan

quote: The good thing about the IMF is there is no European politics involved.
author: Mark Rutte

quote: Rush Limbaugh, we expect nonsense from him. But the Vatican, that's another story. When the Vatican is so threatened that it launches attacks on nuns, well, you know what they say in politics, a hit dog hollers.
author: Jennifer Granholm

quote: Every week I read about myself in a magazine, about something that I haven't done or some place that I've never been or don't even know. It's just gossip, rumors, egos, and politics.
author: Hilary Duff

quote: If we tried to write about politics, you'd realize that we're all a bunch of idiots.
author: Mark Hoppus

quote: When a Cabinet Minister who is sacked for telling lies is re-appointed, in the face of every constitutional convention, only for the same man to be sacked again from the same Cabinet for the same offence by the same Prime Minister no wonder the public are cynical about politics.
author: William Hague

quote: I'm looking forward to the day when America will mature to the point that we are a color-blind society. I'm not so sure that in politics that will ever be reality, because politics has a way of separating us based on skin color.
author: J. C. Watts

quote: And humility in politics means accepting that one party doesn't have all the answers recognising that working in partnership is progress not treachery.
author: Vince Cable

quote: Broadcasters or politicians or writers who think that they are respecting Struggle Street, the battlers, by dumbing things down into one-line sound bites are not respecting them, they are treating them with contempt. It's our job above all in politics to tackle the big issues and to explain them.
author: Malcolm Turnbull

quote: I do not believe that politics in the long run is about individuals. It is about ideas.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: The good news about me is that my friends and social network is entirely independent of politics.
author: Andrew Sullivan

quote: I think it is the responsibility of anyone involved in politics to always think of what Japan can do to contribute more to the peace and stability not just of Japan and the region but of the entire world.
author: Shinzo Abe

quote: In politics, sometimes you have to lie, or you make a promise that you cannot keep.
author: Youssou N'Dour

quote: I enjoy talking about politics a great deal.
author: Seth Meyers

quote: All the politics of the post-war period was about the clash between the Soviet Union and America, and virtually all issues ended up being subordinated to that. Now, the question is, what is the most a socialist can achieve in a global economy?
author: Ken Livingstone

quote: There is a time for everything, also for my time in politics which has been long and eventful. Now I believe it is time for others to take the baton that was passed to me following the crash. I have therefore decided to leave political life at the end of this term.
author: Johanna Siguroardottir

quote: Democracy is a revelation, but it's complicated. There are elections to hold, politics to create, rights to assert, grievances to settle and institutions to build. To many, it's exhilarating. For others, it can be disappointing when it turns out that democracy doesn't immediately make life better.
author: Atifete Jahjaga

quote: I think it is better when people with their own businesses and means of income join politics as there is some degree of honesty and integrity.
author: Vijay Mallya

quote: The Beatles' story is all of our stories. It is about how the youth culture emerged, the drug culture emerged, how politics rose to the fore as a universal debate. It's about rebellion, it's about the growth of the British entertainment system, the growth of the rock n' roll entertainment system.
author: Bob Spitz

quote: My view on politics is much more grassroots oriented; it's not old boy network oriented, so I tend to, you know, come at it a little bit stronger, a little bit more street-wise, if you will. That's rubbed some feathers the wrong way.
author: Michael Steele

quote: I think the record shows that as Speaker, I have taken the lead in cleaning up politics.
author: John Bercow

quote: I am not averse to politics, but that does not mean that I am going to join politics.
author: Rahul Gandhi

quote: I know politics I know the media.
author: Valerie Trierweiler

quote: I keep trying to bring a more professional approach to New Zealand cricket. It's an uphill battle. I stay in the game because I find it intriguing and interesting. I'm not interested in coaching international sides. I don't mind short-term coaching. I don't want to get involved in the politics of teams.
author: Glenn Turner

quote: Real politics is messy and morally ambiguous and doesn't make for a compelling thriller.
author: James Surowiecki

quote: Joy doesn't betray but sustains activism. And when you face a politics that aspires to make you fearful, alienated and isolated, joy is a fine initial act of insurrection.
author: Rebecca Solnit

quote: There are those who maintain that in this world women have no right to interfere in the affairs of state, in politics, in plots and counter-plots. Others that are who, more chivalrous, are willing to admit that women have as much right to act, think, and speak as men.
author: Belle Boyd

quote: As I got older I became a kind of sub cultural junkie, foraging around in music, street fashion and eventually art, politics and the freakier reaches of the Internet, hunting the next discovery, the next seam of underground gold.
author: Hari Kunzru

quote: Any criticism of Thatcher throws a dangerously absurd light on the entire machinery of British politics. Thatcher's name must be protected, not because of all the wrong that she had done, but because the people around her allowed her to do it.
author: Morrissey

quote: Politics has got too personal, too nasty, in Britain, as it has in America.
author: Dan Aykroyd

quote: All the political angst and moral melodrama about getting 'the rich' to pay 'their fair share' is part of a big charade. This is not about economics, it is about politics.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: My father was the Prime Minister of Pakistan. My grandfather had been in politics, too; however, my own inclination was for a job other than politics. I wanted to be a diplomat, perhaps do some journalism - certainly not politics.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: Participatory complexity may well be the key descriptor of the 21st century - in our economies, in our politics, and in our everyday lives.
author: Jamais Cascio

quote: I don't know what's more embarrassing, these musicians and actors talking about politics in interviews or the media actually giving them credibility about it. It's absurd that a celebrity could speak out on the economy or politics with no more justification than a hit album or a movie.
author: Paul Stanley

quote: Television doesn't like politics very well, if you can infer that from the way they cover it.
author: Jack Germond

quote: My mom always talks about how hard it was to grow up in a political family. It's always split up, and just - I want to have fun in life. No, politics isn't on the list.
author: Patrick Schwarzenegger

quote: I don't follow politics it doesn't interest me. So why should I vote?
author: Mario Balotelli

quote: You can't talk about life without talking about politics. You have to have both. If you're just a political person, you're going to burn out. If you, as an artist, are just focused inward, you're going to eventually be irrelevant.
author: Robert Adams

quote: The President's post should not be politicised. Once a president is elected, he is above politics.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quote: One of the reasons MSNBC is plummeting is that I, not long ago, refused to play any content from them. I figured, why? I mean, it's genuine depraved partisan politics insanity, genuine extremist radical ignoramuses on that network.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: People say, 'Oh, politics is so polarized today,' and I'm thinking... '1861, that was polarized.'
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Set politics and party aside: If it's not right for Michigan's small businesses and middle class, it's never been right with me.
author: Gary Peters

quote: The fact I have an education forms my lyrical style, I'm sure. I studied the social sciences, history, stuff like that. I have an interest in politics, which maybe works its way into the songs in small, subtle ways.
author: Dean Wareham

quote: The anchors of the Arab consensus have long been Egypt and Saudi Arabia, and both are now weakened forces in Arab politics and diplomacy.
author: Elliott Abrams

quote: In politics, a picture is worth a thousand words.
author: Kathleen Troia McFarland

quote: I'm not involved in politics, and I've never had any political role. I've never been in office. I've never taken any public administrative jobs.
author: Isabel dos Santos

quote: What modern humans need help with is escaping from the despair of politics, commerce and media, escaping from the drabness and oppressiveness of worldly values and seeing through suburban mentality and normal community standards so that they can find some much-needed relief for their wilting souls.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Economics has become as riveting as politics.
author: Tina Brown

quote: Most people who get in trouble in politics usually get in trouble because they're disconnected from the people they serve, and I don't think anybody in Tennessee, even people who won't vote for me, would accuse me of that.
author: Lamar Alexander

quote: When we say, even in a global village, that all politics is local, we mean that national sovereignties are the only reliable source of political authority.
author: Michael Ignatieff

quote: At a purely practical level, history is important because it provides the basic skills needed for students to go further in sociology, politics, international relations and economics. History is also an ideal discipline for almost all careers in the law, the civil service and the private sector.
author: Antony Beevor

quote: If I'm lucky enough to be involved in the Academy Awards in the future, I'll just let people make up their decision without being involved in any politics. Because it shouldn't involve that.
author: Peter Jackson

quote: In both law and politics, I think the essential battle is the meta-battle of framing the narrative.
author: Ted Cruz

quote: Can I actually make a difference? Can I get people to believe in politics once again? Can I get people to accept more complex answers to complex questions? I know I can. I know that's what I do very well.
author: Justin Trudeau

quote: The appalling reality in American politics today is that, when ideology and money mix, truth is a mere inconvenience.
author: David Horsey

quote: It is my determination that we, as a party, continue to make that fundamental restatement of liberal values in the politics of our country.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: Politics means facing up to hard choices and facing down prejudice, short-termism, the easy, tempting court of knee-jerk public reaction.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: There's no room for petty grievances in politics.
author: Sergei Lavrov

quote: I think politics is like an X-ray machine: Everything is found out eventually.
author: Nicolle Wallace

quote: Every body and thing has politics involved. Every. Single. Thing.
author: Mystikal

quote: When dealing with American politics, you try to follow the money, and that's where it leads you. It doesn't take you to the electoral college or to Princeton. It takes you down the darker alleys of American life.
author: Roger Morris

quote: Just by making a decision to stay out of politics, you are making the decision to allow others to shape politics and exert power over you. And if you are alienated from the current political system, then just by staying out of it, if you do nothing to change it, you simply entrench it.
author: Joan Kirner

quote: A lot of people are surprised when I talk so much about the present, but politics is just a crucial part of archaeology.
author: Sarah Parcak

quote: Politics for me started in violence.
author: Marine Le Pen

quote: The policy of the future cannot forever be determined by the politics of the past - or even the present.
author: Pete Gallego

quote: I'm willing to take a polygraph test to prove that I'm happy about Kahlon's return to politics. He's a good man, a man who cares. It's good to have people like that in politics, I have no problem with that.
author: Yair Lapid

quote: The middle ground in Congress has all but disappeared. The founders intended competing principles and interests to check excesses and create a balance in our politics that would benefit 'we the people.' Gerrymandered districts and a hyped-up fight-night media offer a partial explanation of why we seem to have neither checks nor balances.
author: Donna Brazile

quote: I chose not to go into politics and policy. Those policies are my husband's job.
author: Melania Trump

quote: You can't not approve a merger because you don't like the companies' politics. That's just not right.
author: Blake Farenthold

quote: I was brought up with a scientific outlook on life. It's the way my father deciphers the world - whether it's football, politics or hairstyles. So I don't get anxious about the future, because I was raised to believe and accept that nothing stays the same, and the best way to survive is to adapt.
author: Anne Wojcicki

quote: I'm in no way suggesting that my opinion matters more than anyone else's, of course, but the only thing that bothers me is apathy. People that sit out of the process and complain about it, or pretend that politics isn't a part of their everyday lives.
author: Olivia Wilde

quote: The idea of self-reliance is important to me, and that is echoed, in my way of thinking, by a conservative approach to politics.
author: Kelsey Grammer

quote: Michael Savage turns on a microphone and broadcasts his opinions to faithful followers who enjoy listening to his views on politics, social issues, and anything else that this colorful, provocative, entertaining guy comes up with. It doesn't matter which of his views I agree or disagree with.
author: Mike Gallagher

quote: Family politics are worse than world politics. That's all I can say. You don't get to choose your family you get to choose your friends. Your family is imposed upon you.
author: Michael Cimino

quote: Forget politics and what their platforms were and everything, because you can take whoever you want to take, but the guy that I liked was Nixon... He was a smart man.
author: Terry Bradshaw

quote: Ethics, politics and psychology are all far more difficult to understand now that we know the depths to which human nature can sink.
author: Ephraim Mirvis

quote: A journalist covering politics, most of us are aware of the necessity to try to be sure we're unbiased in our reporting. That's one of the fundamentals of good journalism.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: There's a difference between being politically incorrect and boorish. And we've seen that line crossed a dozen times by smart people who've mistaken politics for punditry.
author: Greg Gutfeld

quote: 2017 may have been that year when identity politics hit a brick wall - and slumped limply on the pavement.
author: Greg Gutfeld

quote: True, the country is divided, but it's not Right and Left. It's Left and Not Left. It is because, for liberals, politics is personal and therefore extremely loud. For the rest of us, we prefer community over calamity.
author: Greg Gutfeld

quote: For Americans of the Greatest Generation that fought World War II and of the Silent Generation that came of age in the 1950s, the great moral and ideological cause was the Cold War. It gave purpose and clarity to our politics and foreign policy, and our lives.
author: Pat Buchanan

quote: In politics, as in physics, every reaction is met with an equal and opposite reaction.
author: Thom Tillis

quote: It is the desire of the good people of the whole country that sectionalism as a factor in our politics should disappear.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom and a great empire and little minds go ill together.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Politics are not the task of a Christian.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: It's such a beautiful sport, with no politics involved, no color, no class. Only as a youngster can you play and as a pro can you win. The game has kept me young, involved and excited and for me to be up here with gems of baseball.
author: Jack Buck

quote: You begin to realize that hypocrisy is not a terrible thing when you see what overt fascism is compared to sort of covert, you know, communal politics which the Congress has never been shy of indulging in.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: In Pakistan politics is hereditary.
author: Imran Khan

quote: People meet in bars after work all over the world and talk about the great problems of life and death and the world and politics and they don't take themselves seriously. They can do nothing else except chat about these things in bars after work.
author: Whitfield Diffie

quote: Fiscal conservatism is just an easy way to express something that is a bit more difficult, which is that the size and scope of government, and really the size and scope of politics in our lives, has grown uncomfortable, unwieldy, intrusive and inefficient.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: I don't know much about politics, and I don't want to know. That's why I rarely involve myself in politics.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: The person I liked the best was Gerald R. Ford. He was the most decent man in politics I ever had any relationships with.
author: Alan Greenspan

quote: I became an actress because my mom wanted me to become an actress. It took me until my mid-30s to realize I actually didn't. I actually wanted to write and direct and be more involved in politics and humanitarian issues.
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: Every policy is shaped by two forces: background analysis and foreground politics. The political forces are loud, self-serving and, in the case of energy policy, well known.
author: Donella Meadows

quote: I am humble Abraham Lincoln. I have been solicited by my friends to become a candidate for the Legislature. My politics are short and sweet, like the old woman's dance.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Money has always been in politics. And I'm not sure you'd want money to be completely out of politics.
author: Bill Gates

quote: When buying and selling are controlled by legislation, the first things to be bought and sold are legislators.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: The best and brightest don't go into politics. The best and brightest are at Goldman Sachs.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Politics is a necessary evil, or a necessary annoyance, a necessary conundrum.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: The more aspects of life that can be moved from private reign to public realm, the better it is for politics.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: American politics is always an open competition.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: Politics is such a torment that I advise everyone I love not to mix with it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The country already has a leader who divides us with the bitter politics of envy. We have to offer an alternative vision.
author: Mitt Romney

quote: I like to talk about lint and coasters, the expansion of the universe and maybe McDonald's. I'm completely turned off by the idea of politics.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I don't like politicians, and I don't like politics. I definitely don't want to be associated with any of them.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Money is the mother's milk of everything, and it certainly is the mother's milk of politics.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: When it comes to politics today, the devils' not in the details; the devil's in the big picture, more often than not just hiding in plain sight.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: On the Left, the best and brightest go into politics - Barack Obama is the epitome of the perfect leftist. On the Right, the best and brightest go make money. Very few conservatives want to endure all the nonsense you have to put up with to run for office.
author: Ted Cruz

quote: Power in politics, sovereignty in America is with we the people, and that is the path to turning this country around: empowering the people.
author: Ted Cruz

quote: There's an old joke that politics is Hollywood for ugly people. An awful lot of the press coverage about Washington reads like coverage of Hollywood. Madonna is having some spat with Sean Penn. Who cares? And who cares which politician is mad at that politician?
author: Ted Cruz

quote: Politics is the art of controlling your environment.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: There might be some serious fun in politics.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Rude people will now & then ask me why I think I know so much about Politics. I tell them it's because I'm Smart... But that is a lie: The real reason is because I'm an incurable Gambling addict.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Partisan rancour and party politics and ideology have got in the way of compromise - and compromise is the only thing that has ever made politics successful.
author: Kevin Spacey

quote: Politics has become so expensive that it takes a lot of money even to be defeated.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Tradition means giving votes to the most obscure of all classes, our ancestors. It is the democracy of the dead. Tradition refuses to submit to that arrogant oligarchy who merely happen to be walking around.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I am the granddaughter of an English woman. I love England and her people and, regardless of politics, consider you to be family... and always will.
author: Nicola Sturgeon

quote: In politics nothing is contemptible.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Finality is not the language of politics.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I think, in politics, half the people are gonna like you, and half the people are not gonna like you, no matter what you do or what you say... It's like there are no right answers. If there were, everyone would choose the right answers. They're all opinions.
author: Tom Brady

quote: Revolution, n. In politics, an abrupt change in the form of misgovernment.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Alliance - in international politics, the union of two thieves who have their hands so deeply inserted in each other's pockets that they cannot separately plunder a third.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Politics - I still think it's a bunch of liars and a bunch of self-interest. It's not about the people: it's about themselves and their rise to power. They are voting on things based on whether they will have the support of the people when they vote next time. They don't have the balls to say, 'I believe in this. I don't care what happens.'
author: Jay-Z

quote: I never saw anything funnier than Texas politics.
author: Molly Ivins

quote: Adroit geo-strategists take new realities into account as they try to imagine how global politics will unfold. In the foreign policy business, however, inertia is a powerful force and 'adroit' a little-known concept.
author: Stephen Kinzer

quote: Politics is a herd mentality. Politicians don't really lead. Politicians reflect what they think is consensus opinion.
author: Gary Johnson

quote: Whenever men take the law into their own hands, the loser is the law. And when the law loses, freedom languishes.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Enter politics, and you enter the glass house; there are no secrets and no places to hide.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: When politics is no longer a mission but a profession, politicians become more self-serving than public servants.
author: Emmanuel Macron

quote: I think people involved in politics make good actors. Acting and politics both involve fooling people. People like being fooled by actors. When you get right down to it, they probably like being fooled by politicians even more. A skillful actor will make you think, but a skillful politician will make you never have to think.
author: Donna Brazile

quote: If you're sick and tired of the politics of cynicism and polls and principles, come and join this campaign.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Well, you know what, I'm 60 years old, and I've been interested in politics since I was on my daddy's knee. During the 1948 election, we were praying for Truman. I know a lot about politics.
author: Roger Ebert

quote: Besides great climates and lovely beaches, California and Greece share a fondness for dysfunctional politics and feckless budgeting.
author: James Surowiecki

quote: I think it's a terrible shame that politics has become show business.
author: Sydney Pollack

quote: This was the way I was brought up to think of politics, that politics was to do with ethics, it was to do with responsibility, it was to do with service, so I think I was conditioned to think like that, and I'm too old to change now.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quote: The largest party in America, by the way, is neither the Democrats nor the Republicans. It's the party of non-voters.
author: Robert Reich

quote: I do not believe that artists or actors and people should be out there like voicing their full-blown opinions on politics because, let's face it, at the end of the day, I'm not that smart of a guy.
author: Kid Rock

quote: I hope to submit to the little pamphlet magazines here 'freelance' and perhaps shall join the Labour Club, as I really want to become informed on politics, and it seems to have an excellent program. I am definitely not a Conservative, and the Liberals are too vague and close to the latter.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: I do have a political agenda. It's to have as few regulations as possible.
author: Dan Quayle

quote: Even before the missteps that I've had, I was never going to run for office. My family is adamantly opposed to it, and frankly, my politics don't necessarily work for the primaries of either of our parties.
author: David Petraeus

quote: Jesus is the politics of the new age He is about the establishment of a kingdom He is the one who has created a new time that gives us the time not only to care for the poor but to be poor. Jesus is the one who makes it possible to be nonviolent in a violent world.
author: Stanley Hauerwas

quote: Politics is perhaps the only profession for which no preparation is thought necessary.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: To those who have exhausted politics, nothing remains but abstract thought.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: If China's expansion into Africa and Russia's into Latin America and the former Soviet Union are any indication, Silicon Valley's ability to expand globally will be severely limited, if only because Beijing and Moscow have no qualms about blending politics and business.
author: Evgeny Morozov

quote: Politics, after all, is largely about power. And power goes to the core of our issues of control and narcissism and need to be right and tendency to divide the human race into 'us' vs. 'them.'
author: John Ortberg

quote: Humility is of central importance I think it's an underappreciated virtue in the contemporary discussion of law and politics.
author: Cass Sunstein

quote: Politics is about the participation and engagement of the wider citizenry - to miss that point would doom us to irrelevance.
author: David Blunkett

quote: As Assistant Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs, a constant concern for me is having our veterans dragged into partisan politics.
author: Tammy Duckworth

quote: You can't write about history without writing about politics at some point. History is about movements of people. 'What is criminality and what is government' is a theme that runs through every history.
author: David Mamet

quote: Normally, I stay away from politics - unless I'm going to run for president.
author: Grace Jones

quote: If you're sort of interested in politics but sort of upset about contemporary politics, it's kind of wonderful to read about periods who were very eloquent and admirable - generally. People are articulating ideas you can sympathize with or understand both sides of. Or at least feel like one side is saying the right things.
author: Whit Stillman

quote: One thing that education can do is it can provide us with an opportunity to understand one another better, and so while I've spent a lot of my time in the world of politics, I've always felt that it is really not politics that will solve this for us.
author: Condoleezza Rice

quote: I didn't run for student council president. I don't see myself in any way in elected office. I love policy. I'm not particularly fond of politics.
author: Condoleezza Rice

quote: A conservative is a man who just sits and thinks, mostly sits.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: When you read about the real history of where feminism comes from, it came from a very political point of view. I don't believe in bringing any politics to an idea like feminism. I love the idea that women should be celebrated, but I also believe men should be, too. We need both - yin and yang.
author: Michelle Phan

quote: Look, the center right coalition in American politics today is best understood as a coalition of groups and individuals that on the issue that brings them to politics what they want from the government is to be left alone.
author: Grover Norquist

quote: While everyone else is thinking about economics and politics, executive salaries and the future of the euro, do the opposite, even if it's hard. Invest in the spirit.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: The world we build tomorrow is born in the stories we tell our children today. Politics moves the pieces. Education changes the game.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: The only security men can have for their political liberty, consists in keeping their money in their own pockets.
author: Lysander Spooner

quote: 'Air' is what the world looks like: An inconvenient mashup of human politics and divine geography. We leave bits and pieces of ourselves and our history in every place we encounter.
author: G. Willow Wilson

quote: I was in elective politics for 24 years. I've made four national races, two for President, two for Vice President. I have found there are other ways to serve, and I'm enjoying them.
author: Al Gore

quote: There's lots about politics I don't feel comfortable with. To talk about the politics of future ideas is impossible in soundbite form.
author: Al Gore

quote: It is the civilian part of the politics that is very, very bad, and we have to change that.
author: Gloria Macapagal Arroyo

quote: When we have a Deputy Prime Minister who tells people not to drive cars but has two Jags himself, and where the Minister who tells people not to have two homes turns out to have nine himself no wonder the public believe politicians are hypocrites.
author: William Hague

quote: I am not deeply involved in Australian politics but I know there are prime ministers, governments around the world who are not acting responsibly in relation to climate change.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: 'Which is stronger, politics or love?' is like asking, 'Which is stronger, exhaling or inhaling?' They are two sides of the same thing.
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: You may think the president is all-powerful, but he is not. He needs a lot of guidance from the Lord.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Nobody likes, you know, the ugly parts of politics.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: An Independent is someone who wants to take the politics out of politics.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: Politics is pop. Our job as comedians - especially me, as a late-night talk show, which is a broader audience - is to amplify what we think America is thinking.
author: Jimmy Fallon

quote: The 1935 Social Security Act established 65 as the age of eligibility for payouts. But welfare state politics quickly becomes a bidding war, enriching the menu of benefits, so in 1956 Congress entitled women to collect benefits at 62, extending the entitlement to men in 1961.
author: George Will

quote: Promising something that seems popular at the time that you know you're never going to deliver - that's the kind of cynical politics that I don't want any part of.
author: Justin Trudeau

quote: 'The Museum of Innocence' is not about politics; it's a love story, but I think it's political in the sense that it wants to capture how a man suppresses a woman.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: At the end of the day, stories connect us, not politics. And there's so many stories out there waiting to be told. It's just a matter of who's out there listening.
author: Jose Antonio Vargas

quote: There's not a self-regulating group of nice fair-playing people in politics. There are a lot of dodgy people in politics.
author: Heather Brooke

quote: Forget the consultants, the pundits and the pollsters; good policy is good politics.
author: Jim DeMint

quote: The end move in politics is always to pick up a gun.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: Compromise makes a good umbrella, but a poor roof; it is temporary expedient, often wise in party politics, almost sure to be unwise in statesmanship.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: There are few things more amusing in the world of politics than watching moderate Republicans charging to the right in pursuit of greater glory.
author: Mario Cuomo

quote: I don't compromise my principles for politics.
author: Chris Christie

quote: You know, I'm not comfortable with people whose politics are static in a democracy.
author: Steve Earle

quote: I didn't come into politics to change the Labour Party. I came into politics to change the country.
author: Tony Blair

quote: In no relationship at the top of any walk of life is it always easy, least of all in politics which matters so much and which is conducted in such a piercing spotlight.
author: Tony Blair

quote: I happen to think it's the politics that makes you electable, but the reason for that is politicians sometimes talk about electability as if it's just a matter of conning the public. Actually, it's a matter of persuading the public, and in my experience, usually, the public gets it right.
author: Tony Blair

quote: There are times in politics when you must be on the right side and lose.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Remember that a civilized nation cannot just have one party; if there were only one party, this would merely be a dictatorship. Politics could not advance.
author: Sun Yat-sen

quote: My hope is that 10 years from now, after I've been across the street at work for a while, they'll all be glad they gave me that wonderful vote.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quote: It is a measure of the framers' fear that a passing majority might find it expedient to compromise 4th Amendment values that these values were embodied in the Constitution itself.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quote: I know many writers who first dictate passages, then polish what they have dictated. I speak, then I polish - occasionally I do windows.
author: Ed Koch

quote: If you don't like the President, it costs you 90 bucks to fly to Washington to picket. If you don't like the governor, it costs you 60 bucks to fly to Albany to picket. If you don't like me - 90 cents.
author: Ed Koch

quote: There is a danger of Scottish politics being between two sets of dinosaurs... the Nationalists who can't accept they were rejected by the people, and some colleagues at Westminster who think nothing has changed.
author: Johann Lamont

quote: I don't think politics has anything to do with left, right, or center. It has to do with trying to do right by people.
author: Paul Wellstone

quote: A politics that is not sensitive to the concerns and circumstances of people's lives, a politics that does not speak to and include people, is an intellectually arrogant politics that deserves to fail.
author: Paul Wellstone

quote: All art is political in the sense that it serves someone's politics.
author: August Wilson

quote: I am a profound pessimist both about life and about human relations and about politics and ecology. Humans are inadequate and stupid creatures who sooner or later make a mess, and those who are trying to do good do a lot more damage than those who are muddling along.
author: A. S. Byatt

quote: Honestly, I'm interested in politics; I'm interested in giving back in some form, performing some sort of civic duty. But I'm not exploring a run for governor or senator or anything along those lines. I'm focused on running Disney.
author: Bob Iger

quote: I never have been involved in politics.
author: Rick Warren

quote: In politics, readily dismissing inconvenient people can easily extend to dismissing inconvenient truths about them.
author: Daniel Goleman

quote: I've been offered political shows before, and I don't know anything about politics and I feel uncomfortable making political opinions - there's consequences to them. I often think I'm wrong, so I really don't like getting in political or religious discussions because of the giant possibility that I might be wrong.
author: Norm MacDonald

quote: My passion for ideas is not matched with a passion for partisan or electoral politics.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: China's stock market is inextricably tied to politics.
author: Kenneth Fisher

quote: Everything is politics.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: In most places in the country, voting is looked upon as a right and a duty, but in Chicago it's a sport.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: He too serves a certain purpose who only stands and cheers.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics, as a practise, whatever its professions, has always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics... have always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: I learnt more about politics during one South Dakota dust storm than in seven years at the university.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: I deliberately did not read anything about the Vietnam War because I felt the politics of the war eclipsed what happened to the veterans. The politics were irrelevant to what this memorial was.
author: Maya Lin

quote: Growing up in politics I know that women decide all elections because we do all the work.
author: Caroline Kennedy

quote: Many politicians are in the habit of laying it down as a self-evident proposition that no people ought to be free till they are fit to use their freedom. The maxim is worthy of the fool in the old story who resolved not to go into the water till he had learned to swim.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Of course there are regrets. I shall regret always that I found my own authentic voice in politics. I was too conservative, too conventional. Too safe, too often. Too defensive. Too reactive. Later, too often on the back foot.
author: John Major

quote: I am sure future historians will say the biggest and most astonishing change in politics has been the embracing of all the tenets of Thatcherism by the party of Keir Hardie: trade union legislation, Europe, the replacement of Trident, 10 per cent tax for people who have made millions from their companies.
author: Robert Harris

quote: Don't get married until you're certain that you're marrying the right girl. How did I know my wife was the one? I'd seen her for a couple of months. I liked her. She was a very creative person and she had a very good grip on politics and business.
author: Brian Wilson

quote: It's true that it's within the realm of cultural politics that young people tend to work through political issues, which I think is good, although it's not going to solve the problems.
author: Angela Davis

quote: The arts community is generally dominated by liberals because if you are concerned mainly with painting or sculpture, you don't have time to study how the world works. And if you have no understanding of economics, strategy, history and politics, then naturally you would be a liberal.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: First lady has been a thankless position. Eleanor Roosevelt was brilliant and had strong views. She was criticized for her politics and for her appearance. Mrs. Roosevelt was attacked for being too involved in politics. Bess Truman was criticized for being uninvolved in politics.
author: Karen DeCrow

quote: When I came into politics I always thought there was a possibility I would be killed.
author: Imran Khan

quote: Justice, sir, is the great interest of man on earth. It is the ligament which holds civilized beings and civilized nations together.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: I want to stay away from politics, or else I'll probably end up putting my size fifteen foot into my mouth.
author: Peter Steele

quote: I would prefer not to be involved in party politics.
author: George Soros

quote: Unfortunately the global warming hysteria, as I see it, is driven by politics more than by science.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: 'The Means' is about power. I have access to political insiders who helped me write a portrait of the real day-to-day in politics, which turned out to be crazier than Wall Street.
author: Douglas Brunt

quote: Politics is a game and a profession. It doesn't really serve the people the politicians are supposed to serve.
author: Kit Harington

quote: When they see me holding fish, they can see that I am comfortable with kings as well as with paupers.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: Few businessmen are capable of being in politics, they don't understand the democratic process, they have neither the tolerance or the depth it takes. Democracy isn't a business.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Though politics is by nature divisive, surely we all can agree that foster children need stability, safety, education, opportunity - and love.
author: Vanessa Diffenbaugh

quote: Politics ruins the character.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Well you know it's dangerous in politics, because especially in the Philippines there's a lot of killing in politics.
author: Manny Pacquiao

quote: Electoral politics was always an objective of the Black Panther party, so Barack Obama is a part of what we dreamed and struggled and died for.
author: Bobby Seale

quote: The military destabilised my government on politically motivated charges.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: For every talent that poverty has stimulated it has blighted a hundred.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: The world is governed by opinion.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Politics, where fat, bald, disagreeable men, unable to be candidates themselves, teach a president how to act on a public stage.
author: Jimmy Breslin

quote: The only politics in this country that's relevant to black people today is the politics of revolution... none other.
author: H. Rap Brown

quote: Businessmen should not put their finger in politics, because they tend to think only of their own self-interest. But I worry about the low morale in Italian industry and the lack of government initiatives to help the poor.
author: Diego Della Valle

quote: I'm a longtime believer in the old adage that sunlight is the best disinfectant, particularly in politics.
author: Mike Quigley

quote: Turn on to politics, or politics will turn on you.
author: Ralph Nader

quote: The argument of the broken window pane is the most valuable argument in modern politics.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quote: Their very conservatism is secondhand, and they don't know what they are conserving.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Fortunately, we Argentines have decided to change. We believe politics needs to be led by public servants with a vocation to give and construct.
author: Mauricio Macri

quote: As politics is disconnected from its ethical and material moorings, it becomes easier to punish and imprison young people than to educate them.
author: Henry Giroux

quote: We are naive and moralistic women. We are human beings who find politics a blight upon the human condition. And do not know how one copes with it except through politics.
author: Kate Millett

quote: I was supposed to be women's lib, and now I'd exceeded it and gone over into international politics.
author: Kate Millett

quote: So you can say whatever you want and quote me however you want about politics and make the next payday, and that's fine because I'm making that deal with you, but just mention the movie along the way, OK?
author: James Woods

quote: There was a widespread indignation in the American media. They were saying, 'How can you make a movie during an election that's about politics? What are you doing? Are you trying to influence people's lives?' To which my response was, 'Well, I hope so.'
author: John Sayles

quote: In Washington, DC, politics dominate even the most casual conversations.
author: Armstrong Williams

quote: It's called political economy because it is has nothing to do with either politics or economy.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: I like Ronald Reagan, who didn't play crass politics, and he just articulated and delivered on broad themes that were needed. Free markets meant free markets. Deregulation. Lower tax rates. Strong national defense. And he was credible and believable.
author: Dave Brat

quote: The problem with modern politics is everybody is doing sound bite stuff. In my stump speech, I give 20 minutes on why I think we're off track. And I think people do really want to engage in a serious high-level discussion on how to get the country back on track because people care about their own country.
author: Dave Brat

quote: Party honesty is party expediency.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Your every voter, as surely as your chief magistrate, exercises a public trust.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: This is not the time for partisan bickering. This is not the time for politics as usual. Some of us are Democrats. Some of us are Republicans. Some of us are Independents. Above all, we must be Oklahomans first.
author: Brad Henry

quote: In politics, the people I most despise are those who have no values.
author: Diane Abbott

quote: But what I'm very interested in, whether it's writing, whether it's hosting a show, whether it's cooking food, I'm just into the discussions of identity, culture and the politics of culture.
author: Eddie Huang

quote: I hate it when politics play too large part in the sport.
author: Jacques Villeneuve

quote: The public seldom forgive twice.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: What politicians want to create is irreversible change because when you leave office someone changes it back again.
author: Estelle Morris

quote: Politics is not a game for naive thinkers. You may go in as an idealist, but you certainly won't come out as one.
author: Honeysuckle Weeks

quote: One's politics are part of one even when one is writing. But if I want to say anything about the state of civil society, I will write an essay. The responsibilities you feel as a novelist are literary ones, I think, not civic ones. And I think politicians are interesting to write about.
author: Thomas Mallon

quote: I have no child to inherit my properties. You, the people, are my only family, and to make you happy is the reason I do politics.
author: Park Geun-hye

quote: Remain close to government and away from politics. It means deal more with the authorities. And less with individuals.
author: Wang Jianlin

quote: In politics, madame, you need two things: friends, but above all an enemy.
author: Brian Mulroney

quote: Beware the politically obsessed. They are often bright and interesting, but they have something missing in their natures; there is a hole, an empty place, and they use politics to fill it up. It leaves them somehow misshapen.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: To an intellectual who is adrift in politics, a theory is an aim; to a true politician his theory is a boundary.
author: Francis Parker Yockey

quote: In a world where global politics is no longer a zero-sum game, it is - or should be - counterintuitive to pursue one's interests without considering the interests of others.
author: Hassan Rouhani

quote: I can't let important policy decisions hinge on the fact that an election is coming up every 90 days.
author: Gerhard Schroder

quote: Although he's regularly asked to do so, God does not take sides in American politics.
author: George J. Mitchell

quote: Even with politics, stuff comes around again. Woody Guthrie would recognize America today.
author: Billy Bragg

quote: From where many of us in the U.K. sit, American politics is hopelessly polarized. All kinds of issues get bundled up into two great heaps. The rest of the world, today and across the centuries, simply doesn't see things in this horribly oversimplified way.
author: N. T. Wright

quote: Freedom of the press is guaranteed only to those who own one.
author: A. J. Liebling

quote: The Vice-Presidency is sort of like the last cookie on the plate. Everybody insists he won't take it, but somebody always does.
author: Bill Vaughan

quote: I was a woman in a man's world. I was a Democrat in a Republican administration. I was an intellectual in a world of bureaucrats. I talked differently. This may have made me a bit like an ink blot.
author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

quote: The Tea Party represents stakeholders in the American system; people who were never involved in politics or thought they had to be, yet realized that political corruption and incompetence threatened not only their families, but the future of the nation itself.
author: Tammy Bruce

quote: I hope that in my books there's an undertone of politics, basic tenets of how we should live.
author: Jasper Fforde

quote: I know my limitations, and I don't like politics. I was only involved because of my husband.
author: Corazon Aquino

quote: Macroeconomic policy can never be devoid of politics: it involves fundamental trade-offs and affects different groups differently.
author: Joseph Stiglitz

quote: Politics is compromise.
author: Paddy Ashdown

quote: Satire is fascinating stuff. It's deadly serious, and when politics begin to break down, there is a drift towards satire, because it's the only thing that makes any sense.
author: Ben Nicholson

quote: You better take advantage of the good cigars. You don't get much else in that job.
author: Thomas P. O'Neill

quote: And after I make a lot of money, I'll be able to afford running for office.
author: Christy Romano

quote: My life experiences have helped me to be less fearful. In politics, that has allowed me to take on issues sooner rather than later.
author: Jackie Speier

quote: A conservative is one who admires radicals centuries after they're dead.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: We're seeing quite a lot of people who really would like a return to class-based politics.
author: Patricia Hewitt

quote: In politics, guts is all.
author: Barbara Castle

quote: It is very creditable when a woman gets into politics. She does this at the expense of responsibilities toward her home and family and should be lauded for this.
author: Preneet Kaur

quote: It is money, money, money! Not ideas, not principles, but money that reigns supreme in American politics.
author: Robert Byrd

quote: I think sometimes women are not driven by the same, albeit, testosterone power thing that pushes men to get into politics.
author: Morgan Fairchild

quote: You cannot spend your way out of recession or borrow your way out of debt.
author: Daniel Hannan

quote: People don't get involved with local charities or politics because they think it's hard to make a difference and the problem feels overwhelming. But I believe that if all I've time for this year is to write one letter to the local council, it's still worth doing.
author: Monica Ali

quote: My father was a businessman, but my mother was an intellectual. She cared about culture, politics, and philosophy, so I became interested in the protest aspect of Latin American art.
author: Jorge M. Perez

quote: In politics people give you what they think you deserve and deny you what they think you want.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quote: People want change but not too much change. Finding that balance is tricky for every politician.
author: Eleanor Clift

quote: If there is a ground zero in the cultural wars, it is Missouri, a state where pro-life groups are strong and well organized and their agenda dominates local politics.
author: Eleanor Clift

quote: Economics, politics, and personalities are often inseparable.
author: Charles Edison

quote: You know they say the most dangerous person of the world is a member of the United States Congress just home from a three-day fact-finding trip.
author: Johnny Isakson

quote: Frankly, I don't mind not being President. I just mind that someone else is.
author: Edward Kennedy

quote: A politician is a person with whose politics you don't agree if you agree with him he's a statesman.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: Be your own politics, grow your own garden, and maybe you can help out more.
author: Rip Torn

quote: It is our experience that political leaders do not always mean the opposite of what they say.
author: Abba Eban

quote: Half a century ago, Ronald Reagan, the man whose relentless optimism inspired me to enter politics, famously said that he didn't leave the Democratic Party; the party left him. I can certainly relate. I didn't leave the Republican Party; it left me.
author: Charlie Crist

quote: In politics the choice is constantly between two evils.
author: John Morley

quote: Our party is a diverse one, as is my home state of Illinois.
author: Dick Durbin

quote: If American politics are too dirty for women to take part in, there's something wrong with American politics.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: I have an aim - I have a clear aim in my mind, and the aim is that I do not like what I see in Indian politics; it is something that is inside my heart.
author: Rahul Gandhi

quote: I was looking for a new challenge and got an interest in trying to make a difference for families. You become more aware of how important families are. They are the key institution in our culture. The reason I got into politics was to try to make a difference for that key institution, whether it was tax policy, education policy, or whatever.
author: Jim Jordan

quote: Confronted with the choice, the American people would choose the policeman's truncheon over the anarchist's bomb.
author: Spiro T. Agnew

quote: I always voted at my party's call, and I never thought of thinking for myself at all.
author: William Gilbert

quote: Before I had decided to get into politics, I was laying the groundwork to have a career in the law, but that was really to lay the foundation to teach, either at the college level or law school level after my federal clerkships.
author: Stephanie Herseth

quote: A purely objective viewpoint does not exist in the cosmos or in politics.
author: Howard Fineman

quote: Social history might be defined negatively as the history of a people with the politics left out.
author: G. M. Trevelyan

quote: After much prayerful consideration, I feel that I must say I have climbed my last political mountain.
author: George C. Wallace

quote: I've always loved history, from my youngest memories. My father enjoyed the great stories of history, like Hereward the Wake, Robin Hood, and Richard the Lionheart, and he shared them with me. I went on to do a degree in history, though I found it rather dry, because it was mostly about politics rather than dashing individuals!
author: Jo Beverley

quote: The Israelis are very smart about politics and strategy, but there are a few exceptions. One is Lebanon, the other is Gaza, where they were completely inept.
author: Daniel Pipes

quote: There's an old rule of thumb in politics that 90 percent of all 90 year-olds vote and 25 percent of all 25 year-olds vote.
author: Joseph P. Kennedy III

quote: We have to ask ourselves why younger women don't feel the need to be right up front with their politics. Is that going to set us back or is that itself a sign of progress? I don't know the answer.
author: Ann Powers

quote: Let's clean up the Senate and return to politics of common ground.
author: Mark Pryor

quote: I know politics and politicians are hated, but I still believe in goodness of a heart that has selfless intentions. With the grace of God, I will make a difference.
author: Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore

quote: It's a no-win situation with politics it's always going to be stressful. I'm more into the comedy of life.
author: Jordan Peele

quote: There seem to me to be very few facts, at least ascertainable facts, in politics.
author: Robert Peel

quote: My friend told me later he got the chicken pox. I told him I caught politics and never got over it.
author: Jack Johnson

quote: I can remember when Democrats believed that it was the duty of America to fight for freedom over tyranny.
author: Zell Miller

quote: A healthy democracy requires a decent society; it requires that we are honorable, generous, tolerant and respectful.
author: Charles W. Pickering

quote: One thing I have learned in my time in politics is that if one of the parties is shameless, the other party cannot afford to be spineless.
author: Frank Lautenberg

quote: Four years in the White House and two presidential campaigns is an awful long time. In politics, every year in the White House is like dog years, six years off your life.
author: George Stephanopoulos

quote: Politics disappears it vanishes. What remains constant is human life. So I try to develop a perspective in my writing where politics is just one of the pieces of furniture in this furnished world. It is not the purpose. It is not the goal.
author: Tatyana Tolstaya

quote: The essential ingredient of politics is timing.
author: Pierre Trudeau

quote: What is politics but persuading the public to vote for this and support that and endure these for the promise of those?
author: Gilbert Highet

quote: I'd like to be for cinema what Shakespeare was for theatre, Marx for politics and Freud for psychology: someone after whom nothing is as it used to be.
author: Rainer Werner Fassbinder

quote: I can't afford to be indifferent to politics, but I don't have personal ambitions.
author: Vagit Alekperov

quote: I wasn't a particularly brilliant student, but on the other hand, I was very active in Student Union affairs and in student politics.
author: Cesar Milstein

quote: I have a temperament that doesn't adapt well to politics. It's because I speak my mind so much.
author: Joaquim Barbosa

quote: I have way too shady a background to get into politics. I was a crazy kid - I was in bands, and I don't think I'd get very far before people started digging up stuff I didn't want them to see.
author: Michael Joseph Kelly

quote: Television is democracy at its ugliest.
author: Paddy Chayefsky

quote: We in the Middle East like to talk politics, we like to argue. Just look at the three prophets - Moses, Jesus and Mohammad. They are all from this small region which creates problems all the time.
author: Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani

quote: The great disadvantage of our present electoral system is that it freezes the pattern of politics, and holds together the incompatible because everyone assumes that if a party splits it will be electorally slaughtered.
author: Roy Jenkins

quote: Reiterating the belief that HIV is the cause of AIDS is an easy thing to do. Understanding the science and politics of the situation is much more complicated and requires study with a critical and open mind.
author: Nate Mendel

quote: Korea can't become a 'first-class' nation unless regulation and 'a sense of power' disappear. The nation's politics is the fourth-class, bureaucratic are the third-class, and business is the second-class.
author: Lee Kun-hee

quote: My character and my behavior is not for politics. I say what I think. I'm too liberal.
author: Naguib Sawiris

quote: There is a type of snobbish, pompous journalist who thinks that the only news that has any validity is war, famine, pestilence or politics. I don't come from that school.
author: Piers Morgan

quote: If a politician murders his mother, the first response of the press or of his opponents will likely be not that it was a terrible thing to do, but rather that in a statement made six years before he had gone on record as being opposed to matricide.
author: Meg Greenfield

quote: I think Syria is in a particularly sensitive geopolitical position in terms of the politics of the Middle East.
author: Edward Luck

quote: There are no true friends in politics. We are all sharks circling, and waiting, for traces of blood to appear in the water.
author: Alan Clark

quote: So begins a question which has of late become more and more urgent: what is the relation of aesthetics to politics?
author: Mark Poster

quote: Some of the FDA's own scientists have charged that politics, not science, is behind the FDA's actions.
author: Joseph Crowley

quote: I'm a wise Latina woman. Whatever, man. Thank God I'm not in politics, because the fact that you have to explain everything - I'd kill myself. I can't take all those little things they dissect. I'm like, 'Oh my God, get a life.' I don't have time for this.
author: Justina Machado

quote: I never let politics get personal. You can have the most intense, heated debate on issues, and so long as you keep it on issues, you can go out and have coffee afterwards and you're good friends.
author: Phil Crane

quote: It was through the private world of family that the public world of politics came alive for me: living in intimate proximity with people for whom larger questions of ideology and belief, as well as issues relating to politics and governance, were vivid daily realities.
author: Sonia Gandhi

quote: A politician will do anything to keep his job - even become a patriot.
author: William Randolph
